0.title: Suspect brought for court hearing shot dead in UP's Hapur
0.article_body: A suspect who was brought for a hearing to the Uttar Pradesh's Hapur District Court was shot dead by unidentified assailants outside the premises on Tuesday. The undertrial had been brought from Haryana for the hearing. The suspect was arrested in Faridabad and when he was brought to court, the assailants surrounded him and fired four-five bullets.

1.title: As coal prices rise, Indian firms import petcoke from Venezuela
1.article_body: Amid surging global coal prices, Indian companies are importing large volumes of petroleum coke (petcoke) from Venezuela, according to trade sources and shipping data. Indian cement companies imported as many as four cargoes carrying 1,60,000 tonnes of petroleum coke between April and June, according to trade sources. Another cargo is expected to reach the Mangalore port soon, the data showed.

2.title: Telangana CM KCR skips Governor’s ‘At Home’ function
2.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao skipped Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan's traditional 'At Home' event on the occasion of Independence Day at Raj Bhavan. He had attended ‘At Home’ functions till 2020 when the relations between the CM’s office and the Raj Bhavan were cordial, reports said. Meanwhile, the CM alleged that the Centre is busy in centralising powers.

3.title: US, China may sleepwalk into conflict over Taiwan: Singapore's Dy PM
3.article_body: Singapore's Deputy PM Lawrence Wong warned that the US and China may "sleepwalk into conflict" if they don't engage with each other and de-escalate rising tensions over Taiwan. The US-China relationship is on a "very worrying" trajectory, Wong said, adding, "We're starting to see a series of decisions being taken by both countries that'll lead us into more...dangerous territory."

4.title: US' KKR sells entire 27% stake in Max Healthcare, raises ₹9,290 cr
4.article_body: US private equity firm KKR sold all of its 27% stake in Max Healthcare and raised ₹9,290 crore on Tuesday. KKR offloaded 26 crore shares at ₹355 apiece. The stake sale, through a block deal, was executed by Kalyan Investments which had invested in Max Healthcare. It sold its stake at a discount of 3.3% to the current market price.

5.title: Washington Sundar ruled out of India's tour of Zimbabwe, replaced by Shahbaz Ahmed
5.article_body: All-rounder Washington Sundar has been ruled out of India's tour of Zimbabwe after injuring his shoulder while playing in a county match in England. He has been replaced by 27-year-old all-rounder Shahbaz Ahmed, who represents Bengal in domestic cricket and RCB in IPL. India will play three ODIs in Zimbabwe starting August 18.

6.title: Sri Lanka Cricket seeks ₹43.5 crore from Arjuna Ranatunga for 'loss of reputation'
6.article_body: The Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) administrators are seeking LKR 2 billion (more than ₹43.5 crore) from former World Cup-winning captain Arjuna Ranatunga for "loss of reputation". The SLC Executive Committee stated that it took the decision after "extensively deliberating" on a "false, derogatory and distorted statement" made by Ranatunga during a recent media interview.

7.title: Forever 21 owner Authentic Brands to buy Ted Baker for $254 million
7.article_body: Authentic Brands (ABG) has agreed to buy Ted Baker in a cash deal worth roughly £211 million ($254 million), the companies announced on Tuesday. The UK-based fashion chain was forced to put itself up for sale in April after it suffered COVID-19 pandemic-related losses. New York-based ABG owns brands like Forever 21, Juicy Couture and Reebok.

8.title: I am seeing it as the Asia Cup, not India vs Pakistan: Sourav Ganguly
8.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said he is looking at the Asia Cup as a tournament rather than considering it as India taking on Pakistan. "When I used to...[play], India vs Pakistan was just another match for me. I always looked to win the tournament," added Ganguly. "India...have done very well in the recent times," he stated.

9.title: Debina Bonnerjee, Gurmeet Choudhary expecting their 2nd baby; share ultrasound pics
9.article_body: Television actors Debina Bonnerjee and Gurmeet Choudhary are expecting their second baby. Debina, who shared a picture of herself hugging Gurmeet and gave a glimpse of ultrasound images, wrote, "Few decisions are divinely timed and nothing can change that...this is one such blessing." The couple welcomed their first child, daughter Lianna, in April this year.

10.title: UP man gets alleged beheading threat after he distributes Tricolour
10.article_body: An FIR has been registered after a man alleged that posters threatening him with beheading were pasted around his house after he distributed the Tricolour in his neighbourhood in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor. A senior police official said that security has been deployed at the man's residence. "Action will be taken on the basis of facts," the senior police official added.

11.title: Film journalist Kaushik LM passes away at 35
11.article_body: Film journalist Kaushik LM has passed away at the age of 35. Kaushik went to sleep at 2 pm on Monday and reportedly suffered a cardiac arrest. "Thinking of you and saying a prayer. You will be missed," actor Vijay Deverakonda tweeted. "This is truly heartbreaking. I so so wish this isn't true," actor Dulquer Salmaan wrote.

12.title: 'Dostvaad' should also end: Sisodia on PM's 'Parivarvaad' remark
12.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said not just 'Parivarvaad' (dynasty politics), but 'Dostvaad' (favouring friends) should also be ended to cleanse the country of corruption. "Dostvaad has destroyed the country's economy," Sisodia said at a press conference on Monday. His comments came after PM Modi called upon people to extend their support in the "fight against nepotism and dynasty systems".

13.title: PM Modi extends birthday wishes to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal
13.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday greeted Delhi CM and AAP national convenor on his 54th birthday. "Birthday greetings to Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal Ji. I pray for his long life and good health," PM Modi tweeted. Kejriwal replied saying, "Thank you sir." Meanwhile, other politicians including Bhagwanth Khuba, Hardeep Singh Puri and Supriya Sule also wished CM Kejriwal.

14.title: Delhi boys return from holiday, find mom, grandmother dead with stab wounds
14.article_body: A 70-year-old woman and her daughter-in-law were found dead when the former's grandsons, who were on a holiday in Uttarakhand, returned and found their bodies with stab wounds. Police said that no signs of forced entry into the house were found and that the boys found the main door partially open. Investigators suspect involvement of someone known to the women.

15.title: Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel announces 3% DA hike for govt employees
15.article_body: Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel, on the occasion of India's 76th Independence Day on Monday, announced a 3% hike in the dearness allowance (DA) for state government employees under the 7th Pay Commission, with retrospective effect from January 1, 2022. The hike will benefit around 9.38 lakh employees of the Gujarat government, panchayat service and pensioners, Patel added.

16.title: iSelect Guaranteed Future Plan for financial planning: Canara HSBC
16.article_body: iSelect Guaranteed Future Plan presented by Canara HSBC is a life insurance savings cum protection plan that provides you 5 options to cater to your needs with Pay or Premium Protection Cover. The plan offers tax saving benefits along with an alternate source of savings to help you achieve your financial goals, it stated.

17.title: Militant group claims it killed 4 Russian mercenaries in Mali
17.article_body: An Al-Qaeda-affiliated terrorist group on Monday claimed that it had killed four mercenaries from Russia's private military firm Wagner Group in an ambush in central Mali. The militants of Jama'at Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimeen (JNIM) group reportedly clashed with the Russian mercenaries on Saturday in the Mopti region. Mali has been fighting Islamist insurgency for decades.

18.title: Heavy rain in Mumbai; MeT predicts occasional intense showers in next 24 hrs
18.article_body: Mumbai witnessed heavy rainfall on Tuesday as rain intensity increased in the city after a gap of a few days. As per Meteorological department's forecast, cloudy sky with moderate rain in Mumbai and suburbs with occasional intense spells is expected for the next 24 hours. There will be a high tide of 4.39 metres in Arabian Sea, an official said.

19.title: Indian team looks different when Hardik is in full flow: Zimbabwe batting coach
19.article_body: Zimbabwe batting coach Lance Klusener has said India looks different when all-rounder Hardik Pandya is in "full flow". He added, "Hardik adds glue to any white-ball side...It's so good to have him back and he's getting into the form we are accustomed to." Hardik is not part of India's squad for the three-match ODI series against Zimbabwe.

20.title: Team India was 'not that' aggressive under Virat Kohli: Aakash Chopra
20.article_body: Former India opener Aakash Chopra said Virat Kohli was very aggressive on the field while leading Team India but his team was "not that" aggressive. "He talked about intent many times but we saw [Cheteshwar] Pujara getting run out twice in one match," added Aakash. "Rohit Sharma...doesn't look animated but the team that plays under him attacks," he stated.

21.title: Ask senior Muslim community members to take action: BJP MLA on Shivamogga incident
21.article_body: BJP MLA KS Eshwarappa reacted to the stabbing incident following communal clashes in Shivamogga, saying, "I request senior members of Muslim community to take action against youth of their community [who are] involved in such anti-national activities." Four people, identified as Nadeem, Tanveer, Charbi and Abdul Rehman, were arrested in connection with the stabbing incident, PTI reported.

22.title: Kunal Ghosh gives secret news of TMC to BJP: BJP MP Saumitra Khan
22.article_body: BJP MP Saumitra Khan has claimed that TMC spokesperson Kunal Ghosh gives the "secret news" of TMC to BJP. "When Ghosh was in jail even then he used to pass on inside news of TMC to people and even now after meeting [Dharmendra] Pradhan, Ghosh continues to give the secret news of TMC to BJP," Khan added.

23.title: Bus carrying 39 security personnel falls into riverbed after brake fail in J&K, 6 martyred
23.article_body: Six Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) personnel have lost their lives, while several others received injuries after a bus carrying 37 ITBP personnel and two personnel from Jammu and Kashmir Police fell into a riverbed in Pahalgam after its brakes reportedly failed on Tuesday. Injured personnel are being airlifted to Army hospital, Srinagar for treatment, police said.

24.title: Bipasha Basu expecting 1st child with Karan Singh Grover, shares pics
24.article_body: Actress Bipasha Basu on Tuesday announced that she is expecting her first child with actor-husband Karan Singh Grover. Sharing pictures, she wrote, "A new time, a new phase, a new light adds another unique shade to our prism of life." "A creation manifested by our love, our baby will join us soon and add to our glee," she added.

25.title: 20 people burnt alive in bus-oil tanker collision in Pakistan
25.article_body: At least 20 people were burnt alive in a collision between a passenger bus and an oil tanker in Pakistan's Punjab province, rescue officials said. The accident occurred on a highway in Multan, around 350 km from Lahore, allegedly because of over-speeding, the police said. "The bodies will be handed over to the families after a DNA test," officials said.

26.title: Berkshire Hathaway buys more Apple, Chevron shares, sells Verizon stock
26.article_body: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway purchased 3.9 million shares of Apple in the second quarter, increasing its stake in the firm to 5.6%. It also raised its stake in Chevron to about 8.2% by buying around 2.3 million more shares of it. Among the holdings that were disposed of by Berkshire in Q2 were Verizon and Royalty Pharma.

27.title: Want to play a man who wears uniform as my dad was in Army: Abhishek
27.article_body: Actor Abhishek Banerjee has said that he wants to play a role of a man who wears a uniform. Speaking about the reason, he said, "I've seen my dad, he was in the Army...I've seen him waking up at 4 am and doing the duties," he added. Abhishek added he's closely seen the physical and mental endurance the officers need.

28.title: It's 1st time I'll share stage with Nick: Priyanka on Global Citizen festival
28.article_body: Speaking about the Global Citizen music festival, actress Priyanka Chopra has said that it will be the first time she will share the stage with her husband Nick Jonas. "It'll be very exciting. I love the Jonas Brothers, but I'm...excited to see Mariah Carey and Rosalía," she further added. Metallica and Charlie Puth will also feature at the music festival.

29.title: Germany's Scholz voices support for Russian refugees coming to EU
29.article_body: During a summit in Oslo, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said people are fleeing Russia because they disagree with the Russian regime. The statement comes amid an ongoing debate over EU visa ban on Russian citizens. Finnish PM Sanna Marin said she didn't think it was right for Russians to go ''sightseeing'' in the EU while the Russian military kills Ukrainians.

30.title: Suspended railway policeman held in Pune in 'rice puller' metal scam
30.article_body: Pune Police arrested a suspended railway police sub-inspector in connection with the 'rice puller' metal scam. The accused allegedly cheated around 200 people in Maharashtra on the pretext of investing in a 'rice puller' metal, also called 'copper iridium', used by aerospace organisations to make space equipment. This comes after two brothers from Pune were cheated of ₹49 lakh.

31.title: Petrol, diesel demand sees a slump in August due to monsoons
31.article_body: With the onset of the monsoon, the fuel demand saw a slump in sectors such as agriculture, preliminary industry data showed. While petrol consumption remained flat in the first half of August, diesel demand witnessed an 11.2% drop compared with the first half of July. The demand for petrol and diesel is traditionally lower in July-September than in April-June.

32.title: India might have nomination in 'final 5' if RRR is picked: Kashyap on Oscars
32.article_body: Talking about the Oscars, filmmaker Anurag Kashyap said, "India might...have a nomination in the final five if 'RRR' is the film...we pick." Kashyap added there are "99% chances" of 'RRR' being nominated for the Oscars if selected as India's official entry. "[The West] finds it better than any Marvel movie. They've...gone crazy even at the film's silliness," he stated.

33.title: MMRDA plans tunnel to connect Eastern Freeway to Girgaon Chowpatty: Report
33.article_body: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) is reportedly exploring the possibility of constructing a tunnel to connect Eastern Freeway from P D'Mello Road to Girgaon Chowpatty to ensure smooth access to the coastal road. As per the report, MMRDA has invited bids to finalise a consultant to conduct a feasibility study and make a detailed project report.

34.title: Around 30 ministers join Bihar Cabinet, Tejashwi Yadav's brother Tej Pratap sworn-in
34.article_body: Nearly 30 leaders, including Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Tejashwi Yadav's brother and RJD leader Tej Pratap Yadav, were sworn in as part of Bihar's new Cabinet under Chief Minister Nitish Kumar. Ahead of the Cabinet expansion, JD(U) MLA Leshi Singh on Tuesday confirmed that she will be getting a post in the new cabinet.

35.title: Bite marks on man's face help police catch him for molesting 17-yr-old girl in Thane
35.article_body: Bite marks on a man's face helped the Thane police trace and arrest him for allegedly molesting a 17-year-old girl on a skywalk in Maharashtra's Thane. Police said that the accused allegedly caught hold of her from behind and molested her, following which she resisted his move and bit his face to free herself. She later approached the police.

36.title: Person hoists religious flag above national flag in Goa; arrested
36.article_body: A 43-year-old man was arrested on Monday for allegedly hoisting a religious flag above the national flag at his rented accommodation in Goa's Ponda. A police inspector told IANS that the other flag "is not Pakistan's national flag, but a resemblance". A case has been filed under Section 2 of the Prevention of Insults to National Honour Act, 1971.

37.title: US Justice Dept opposes revealing evidence supporting search of Trump’s home
37.article_body: The US Justice Department opposed efforts to make public the affidavit supporting the search warrant for ex-US President Donald Trump's Florida home, saying the document contains sensitive material. Making the affidavit public would also "cause significant and irreparable damage to this ongoing criminal investigation," it added. Many news organisations have applied to have the affidavit unsealed.

38.title: A film rich in merit can take boycott, 'Laal...' didn't have merit: Taran
38.article_body: Film critic Taran Adarsh said a film rich in merit can withstand boycott and any opposition in the form of exams, IPL matches and bad weather. "'Laal Singh Chaddha'...was devoid of merit," he added. "The stars are still sleeping," stated Taran. Producer Girish Johar earlier said the box office start of 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 'Raksha Bandhan' had sent "shockwaves".

39.title: We're asking India to bring their A game: Zimbabwe batting coach Lance Klusener
39.article_body: Zimbabwe batting coach and ex-South Africa all-rounder Lance Klusener has said they want India to bring their "A game" in their upcoming three-match ODI series. "It's a series we're looking forward to...they may be too strong for us but if we play well and put them under pressure, then ODI cricket is a funny game...anything can happen," he added.

40.title: Adani Logistics acquires ICD in Gujarat's Tumb for ₹835 crore
40.article_body: Adani Logistics on Tuesday announced that it has acquired an inland container depot (ICD) in Gujarat's Tumb from Navkar Corporation for ₹835 crore. ICD Tumb has a capacity of 0.5 million TEU and is located between the Hazira port and the Nhava Sheva port. Adani Logistics is a wholly owned subsidiary of Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Limited.

41.title: Sidharth Malhotra & Kiara Advani to reunite after 'Shershaah': Report
41.article_body: Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani will reportedly reunite for a film after 'Shershaah'. As per a report by India Today, the film is titled 'Adal Badal' and will be produced by Sunir Kheterpal. "The movie is set to be a rom-com with a lot of VFX and CGI work involved as well," a source close to the development said.

42.title: US, S Korea, Japan hold missile defence drills for the 1st time since 2017
42.article_body: US, South Korea and Japan carried out a ballistic missile defence exercise off Hawaii's coast, the Pentagon said in a statement. It was first such exercise since 2017 which saw participation of the three countries. The Pentagon's statement said that the drills demonstrated the three countries' commitment to respond to challenges posed by North Korea and protect shared security.

43.title: H&M back on Alibaba's Tmall, 16 months after Xinjiang controversy
43.article_body: Swedish fashion retailer H&M's official store on Alibaba's Tmall e-commerce platform reopened after the latter had taken it down 16 months earlier. H&M had cited concerns about human rights abuses in China's Xinjiang and had pledged not to source cotton from that region. According to UN experts and other rights groups, Uyghurs and other minorities have been detained in Xinjiang.

44.title: US' World Trade Centre digitally displays Tricolour to celebrate India's Independence Day
44.article_body: The World Trade Centre in New York digitally displayed the Tricolour to celebrate India's Independence Day. Earlier, US President Joe Biden extended wishes to India, saying, "The US joins the people of India to honour its democratic journey, guided by Mahatma Gandhi's enduring message of truth and non-violence." He also said that India and US are "indispensable partners".

45.title: Jhunjhunwala's 1st purchase of Titan stock was made by chance: Damani
45.article_body: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's first purchase of Titan Company stock was made by chance, investor Ramesh Damani has revealed. "There is this folklore that he bought Titan after studying it or after accessing some insider information, but...he bought it because his broker had a lot and he came to Rakesh before going to anyone else," Damani told Moneycontrol.

46.title: Investment firm Tiger Global cuts stakes in most companies amid losses
46.article_body: US-based investment firm Tiger Global Management has slashed or completely exited most of its holdings in the second quarter, according to a filing released on Monday. Tiger Global reduced positions in Microsoft, Coinbase, DoorDash, JD.com, Nu Holdings, Snowflake, CrowdStrike Holdings and Carvana. According to the filing, the firm dissolved investments in Robinhood, Zoom Video Communications.

47.title: 72 farmers arrested for not protesting at designated site in B'luru
47.article_body: About 72 farmers were arrested on Monday for not protesting at Freedom Park, which is the only designated protesting site in Bengaluru. Farmers in Devanahalli have been protesting against Karnataka Industrial Area Development Board's (KIADB) proposal to purchase 1,777 acres of fertile land. According to reports, 387 families will lose their land if KIADB goes ahead with the acquisition.

48.title: It’s nation’s demand that Nitish Kumar leads country, Oppn: JD(U) MLA
48.article_body: JD(U) MLA Leshi Singh on Tuesday said that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar will take the state to new heights. "It’s the demand of the nation that he leads the country, leads the Opposition in the country," Singh added. "Mahagathbandhan government will work well, the pace of development will increase and work will be firmly done," Singh stated.

49.title: Shiv Sena MLA slaps catering manager over quality of food for labourers; video surfaces
49.article_body: Rebel Shiv Sena MLA Santosh Bangar purportedly abused and slapped a private catering manager on Monday over serving poor quality mid-day meal food to labourers in his constituency of Hingoli in Maharashtra. A video of the incident has surfaced online and has gone viral on social media. Notably, Bangar had joined Eknath Shinde's camp minutes before the Assembly floor test.

50.title: Apple lays off about 100 contract-based recruiters in a rare move: Report
50.article_body: Apple laid off about 100 contract-based recruiters across regions in the past week in a rare move for the world's most valuable company, Bloomberg reported. Terminated contractors will reportedly receive pay and medical benefits for two weeks. During the earnings call, CEO Tim Cook had said that Apple will be "deliberate" with spending decisions as it faces an economic slowdown.

51.title: Took Navy base pics, flew drone; police said 'Not allowed to do it': Aayush
51.article_body: Actor Aayush Sharma recalled an incident when he got in trouble with police while he was a student. "I went somewhere in South Mumbai and took pictures of a Navy base, I had flown a drone. Suddenly they told me 'you aren't allowed to do this' and I said 'I'm so sorry'," he added.

52.title: Putin critic Navalny says he’s in solitary confinement
52.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin's critic Alexey Navalny on Monday said prison officials ordered him to serve at least three days in solitary confinement following his efforts to create a labour union in jail. He added that prison authorities have warned that it would become his "permanent residence" unless he reconsiders his "attitude". Navalny is currently serving an 11.5-year sentence.

53.title: Female SI catches mobile snatcher who was trying to escape in Delhi
53.article_body: A female Sub-Inspector (SI) of the Delhi Police, Kiran Sethi, caught a person who was trying to escape after snatching the phone of a man waiting at a bus stand in Kamla Market, officials said on Monday. The 30-year-old accused was previously involved in two cases of snatching, DCP (Central) Shweta Chauhan said. The mobile was recovered, she added.

54.title: 2 arrested for stabbing during communal clashes in Karnataka's Shivamogga
54.article_body: Police arrested two accused in connection with Karnataka's Shivamogga stabbing case during communal clashes, ADGP Law and Order Alok Kumar said. Notably, two others are absconding, he added. "We will seize the accused's properties," Kumar stated. Section 144 was imposed in parts of Shivamogga after Hindu activists protested against attempts to remove Veer Savarkar's poster on Independence Day.

55.title: I believe Virat will find form in Asia Cup: Sourav Ganguly
55.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly has said former India captain Virat Kohli, who has been on a break since the England tour, will find his form in the upcoming Asia Cup. "Let him practice, let him play matches. He is a big player and has scored plenty of runs. I am hopeful that he will make a comeback," stated Ganguly.

56.title: 'Kejriwal model' can make India a world leader:  Manish Sisodia
56.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that "Kejriwal model" is the only proven blueprint that can make India a world leader. Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's Independence Day speech, he said, "PM presented vision of making India a developed nation...This will be possible only when the Centre will put politics aside and work collaboratively on blueprint given by Delhi CM."

57.title: IAF rescues 2 persons trapped in flash floods in J&K's Kathua
57.article_body: The Indian Air Force rescued two persons trapped in the Ujh river following flash floods in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district. Over a dozen animals were also trapped in the river but they couldn't be saved. According to reports, two IAF helicopters deployed for rescue operations have saved seven people in the district so far.

58.title: President Droupadi Murmu greets people on Parsi New Year
58.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu congratulated citizens on the occasion of Navroz - Parsi New Year. The President said, “On the auspicious occasion of Parsi New Year, I extend my warm greetings and best wishes to all my fellow citizens, especially our Parsi brothers and sisters. The Parsi community has significantly contributed to the development of our nation through their hard work."

59.title: Trump's ex-lawyer Giuliani a target in criminal probe into 2020 election
59.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's ex-lawyer Rudy Giuliani is a target in the criminal investigation into possible illegal attempts to interfere in 2020 election in Georgia. Giuliani could face criminal charges from the investigation by Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis. On Wednesday, Trump's former lawyer will testify before a special grand jury empanelled on Willis' request.

60.title: Giriraj Singh challenges Bihar CM to form his own govt
60.article_body: Union Minister Giriraj Singh criticised Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and called him "amarbel". Singh said, "Nitish Babu will break the record of being CM for 20 years, but he is like an 'amarbel' that will never be able to become a tree. Bharatiya Janata Party made him the Chief Minister last year. I challenge Nitish to form his own government."

61.title: Tricolour hoisted at world’s highest battlefield
61.article_body: The Indian Army soldiers hoisted the Tricolour at the Siachen Glacier on the occasion of Independence Day and sang the National Anthem. They also posed for the cameras with the National Flag. The Fire and Fury Corps of the Indian Army shared the video on Twitter showing jawans walking with the National Flag and hoisting it.

62.title: 7,500 sq ft Tricolour displayed at Dal Lake in Srinagar on I-Day
62.article_body: In a joint effort by Ministry of Tourism and two educational institutions, a 7,500 square feet Tricolour was displayed at the bank of Srinagar's Dal Lake on Monday, as part of 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign, ministry said. The flag weighed between 80-85 kg with supporting elements. The same Tricolour was displayed at Gujarat's Statue of Unity on October 31, 2021.

63.title: MSRTC plans to run electric buses from Thane & Borivali to Pune
63.article_body: The Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) is planning to run air-conditioned electric buses, called Shivai, from Thane and Borivali to Pune. The Shivai buses will replace MSRTC's Shivneri buses on the route. "We have placed an order for 150 air-conditioned electric buses and the first phase of the deliveries is expected in October," MSRTC MD Shekhar Channe said.

64.title: Court approves Apple's $30.5 million settlement in bag check lawsuit
64.article_body: A federal judge in California approved Apple Inc's $30.5 million settlement in a lawsuit that claimed that the company didn't pay nearly 15,000 retail workers for the time they spent in security checks after their shift. In 2020, the California Supreme Court ruled that state law mandated workers to be paid when they go through mandatory security checks.

65.title: India sees 8,813 new COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, lowest in 63 days
65.article_body: India has reported 8,813 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, a drop of 40.9% over the previous day and lowest since June 14. India also reported 29 deaths, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Active cases in the country reached 1,11,252, while the daily positivity rate stood at 4.15%.

66.title: Ronaldo was decisive: Ballon d'Or organisers on his selection ahead of Messi
66.article_body: With Cristiano Ronaldo nominated for Ballon d'Or 2022 and Lionel Messi not making it to the shortlist for the first time since 2005, Ballon d'Or organisers France Football said, "Ronaldo was extremely decisive." "He became the top scorer in national football this season (117 goals)," they added. "The new criteria for...Ballon d'Or were unfavourable to Messi," stated France Football.

67.title: No corruption reported at central level under PM Modi: Maha Governor
67.article_body: Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari on Monday said there hasn't been any corruption at the central level in last eight years of PM Modi's government. "In some places (states), officials give in writing that leaders are demanding bribes...how unfortunate it is for the country," Koshyari said. He was addressing a gathering in Pune to mark 75 years of Zilla Parishad.

68.title: Giving it the Zidane, jokes Rio Ferdinand on Darwin Nunez's headbutt
68.article_body: Reacting to Liverpool's Darwin Nunez being sent off in a Premier League match against Crystal Palace following a headbutt, ex-Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand jokingly tweeted, "Giving it the [Zinedine] Zidane." Liverpool were held to a 1-1 draw. France's Zidane was sent off in the 2006 FIFA World Cup final for headbutting former Italy defender Marco Materazzi.

69.title: Rohit Sharma posts pic with National Flag; Twitter users claim its 'photoshopped'
69.article_body: Rohit Sharma posted a picture of himself holding the National Flag on Independence Day and tweeted, "75 years of independence." Reacting to his picture, several Twitter users pointed out that the image is photoshopped. One of the users zoomed in on the picture and wrote, "I thought just the flag was edited, but rod too."

70.title: Apple threatening to fire me for posting TikTok video on security tips: Employee
70.article_body: A New York-based Apple employee has alleged that the company is threatening to fire her for posting a viral TikTok video on iPhone security tips. Paris Campbell had posted a video asking a woman not to remove her lost iPhone from Apple ID in response to blackmailers. Campbell was told she breached company policy by identifying herself as Apple employee.

71.title: Former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee's foster daughter pays tribute on his death anniversary
71.article_body: Former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee's foster daughter Namita Kaul Bhattacharya paid floral tribute at 'Sadaiv Atal' in Delhi on his death anniversary on Tuesday. The former PM had adopted Namita, who is the daughter of Rajkumari Kaul, Vajpayee's classmate in college and his companion. President Droupadi Murmu and PM Narendra Modi also paid their tributes to former PM Vajpayee.

72.title: CPI(M) leader hacked to death in Kerala, party blames BJP, RSS
72.article_body: A 40-year-old CPI(M) leader, K Shajahan, was hacked to death in Kerala's Palakkad district by a six-member gang on Sunday, police said. He was attacked in the Kottekad region with sharp-edged weapons, added police. He was declared brought dead at a hospital. The party blamed the BJP and the RSS for the murder but both refuted the allegation.

73.title: Former BCCI Secretary Amitabh Choudhary passes away due to heart attack
73.article_body: Former BCCI Acting Secretary Amitabh Choudhary passed away on Tuesday morning after suffering a heart attack. Choudhary had served as Jharkhand State Cricket Association (JSCA) President from 2002 to 2017. He was also a former IPS officer, having served as Additional DGP of Jharkhand. Choudhary also held the post of Chairman of Jharkhand Public Service Commission (JPSC) for 20 months.

74.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states; list released
74.article_body: The IMD has predicted isolated very heavy rainfall in Rajasthan, west Madhya Pradesh and Gujarat on Tuesday. Heavy rainfall is likely over Odisha and West Bengal on August 18 and 19 and over Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh and east Madhya Pradesh on August 19. Meanwhile, heavy falls are likely over Himachal Pradesh on August 18 and Uttarakhand on August 18 and 19.

75.title: Donald Trump's passports returned after he says FBI 'stole' them during raid
75.article_body: Passports belonging to Donald Trump have been returned to the former US President after last week's FBI search of his Mar-a-Lago home, a Justice Department official told NBC News. Trump had said agents "stole my three passports, along with everything else". "This is an assault on a political opponent at a level never seen before in our country," he added.

76.title: Entire Cabinet reflects Bihar's interest, you will see that: RJD MP
76.article_body: Ahead of Bihar Cabinet expansion, RJD MP Manoj Kumar Jha said that it is not just people who will join the Cabinet, every worker and MLA of RJD is a part of it. "They may not join under their names but there will be everyone's participation," Jha added. "The entire Cabinet reflects Bihar's interest, you will see that," Jha stated.

77.title: Ex-BJP MLA Amrita Meghwal threatened at gunpoint in Rajasthan
77.article_body: Former BJP MLA Amrita Meghwal was allegedly threatened at gunpoint by four to five unidentified people after they stopped her vehicle while she was travelling from Ajmer to Jalore in Rajasthan, police said. An FIR has been filed in the matter. The accused also smashed the windscreen of the vehicle, a Station House Officer (SHO) said.

78.title: First is Alia Bhatt: Naga Chaitanya on actresses he wishes to work with
78.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya, during an interview, was asked about the actresses he wishes to work with in future. To this, the actor said, "There are many...First is Alia Bhatt. I love her performances." He further named Priyanka Chopra and Kareena Kapoor Khan and said he looked up to their work. "Katrina Kaif, I found her really beautiful," he concluded.

79.title: Not a diktat: Maha Min on rule to say 'Vande Mataram' on receiving calls
79.article_body: Maharashtra's newly appointed Cultural Affairs Minister Sudhir Mungantiwar said that the use of "Vande Mataram" instead of "hello" by government employees while receiving phone calls was not a diktat but it was just a suggestion. His clarification came after he received criticism from NCP leaders Ajit Pawar and Chhagan Bhujbal and Raza Academy chief Muhammad Saeed Noori.

80.title: Wild elephants attack people in Assam; 3 including child killed
80.article_body: Three persons, including a child, were killed after wild elephants attacked people in a village in Assam's Goalpara on Monday. A herd of wild elephants had come to the area in search of food from the nearby hill area of Meghalaya, according to a forest official. The incident took place along Assam-Meghalaya's bordering area, a Forest Range Officer said.

81.title: China sanctions 7 Taiwanese officials for supporting independence
81.article_body: China has sanctioned seven Taiwanese officials for supporting Taiwan's independence, Chinese state news agency Xinhua said. Among those sanctioned are Hsiao Bi-khim, Taiwan's envoy to US, and chief of Taiwan's National Security Council, Wellington Koo. This comes after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan, a move China said had sent a wrong signal to pro-independence forces on the island.

82.title: Hyderabad Police officer among 5 killed in road accident in K'taka
82.article_body: Five persons died and four others were injured in a road accident that took place in Karnataka's Bidar district on Monday. The deceased included G Giridhar, who worked as head constable with Hyderabad Police, his family and their driver. According to police, the accident took place as the car they were travelling in collided with the truck near a check-post.

83.title: How does the Premier League table read after Gameweek 2?
83.article_body: Two-time defending champions Manchester City are on top of the Premier League points table with six points from two games in the season so far. Arsenal, also with two wins, are placed second due to goal difference and are followed by Brentford. Manchester United are at the bottom for the first time in 30 years after the second weekend.

84.title: Maximum output through limited resources: Next CJI on agenda for term
84.article_body: Justice Uday Umesh Lalit, who will succeed CJI NV Ramana as the next Chief Justice of India, said the agenda for his term would be "maximum output through the limited resources". "It can be achieved by clubbing cases...listing matters that can be representative in other cases which are capable of disposing of many pending matters in lower authorities," he added.

85.title: Brazil's Lula holds 12% lead over incumbent Bolsonaro: Opinion poll
85.article_body: Former Brazilian President Lula da Silva has a lead over incumbent Jair Bolsonaro by 12-percentage-point, a new IPEC opinion poll showed. Lula, the leftist leader, has 44% voter support while Bolsonaro, the far-right leader, has 32% voter support in the first round of election, the survey said. Lula is expected to win run-off on October 30 by a 16-point lead.

86.title: Video of Johnny Depp's lookalike at religious ceremony in Iran goes viral
86.article_body: A video of a man attending a religious ceremony in Iran has gone viral on social media for his resemblance to Hollywood actor Johnny Depp. The video first appeared on TikTok and was later shared on other platforms such as Reddit. According to local media, the man's name is Amin Sa'les and he is a model.

87.title: People said 'It's a video of Punjabi wedding': Mohnish on 'Hum Aapke...'
87.article_body: Mohnish Bahl recalled the initial reactions to the 1994 film 'Hum Aapke Hain Koun..!' and revealed, "Some said that 'Yeh toh Punjabi shaadi ka video hai (It's a video of a Punjabi wedding)'." However, Mohnish stated that director Sooraj Barjatya made 'Hum Aapke Hain Koun..!' with his conviction. The film featured Salman Khan and Madhuri Dixit.

88.title: No country’s judges have workload like that handled by judges in India: Rijiju
88.article_body: Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said it's easy to make sweeping comments on what the judiciary must do but reality is that India with its teeming population faces "unique challenges" which are "not easy to handle". "Each judge (in India) disposes of 40-50 cases in a day...judges of no other country have this kind of workload to handle," Rijiju added.

89.title: Walmart reaches video-streaming deal to offer Paramount+ to members
89.article_body: Walmart has struck a deal with Paramount Global to offer Paramount+ streaming service to the subscribers of its membership program. Walmart+ members will get access to Paramount's "essential" plan, which costs $4.99 per month and includes commercials. Members can also avail of the $9.99-a-month service without commercials. With this Walmart seeks to challenge Amazon's Prime membership programme.

90.title: Chinese 'spy ship' arrives at Sri Lanka port amid protest by India
90.article_body: A Chinese ship with abilities to track satellites and intercontinental missiles arrived at Hambantota port in Sri Lanka this morning. The ship, Yuan Wang 5, was allowed to dock on the condition that it will not carry out any research while in Sri Lankan waters. Sri Lanka had earlier asked China to defer the ship's planned visit after India's protest.

91.title: 4 including retired policeman, wife die as truck rams into house in UP
91.article_body: At least four persons, including a retired sub-inspector and his wife, died and five others were injured on Monday after a truck rammed into a house in Uttar Pradesh's Mainpuri, police said. "Two people in the truck also died...One still stuck in debris," Mainpuri SP added last night. The accident took place after the driver lost control of the truck.

92.title: Nothing to do with talent: Apurva on being picked for Pardes over Salman
92.article_body: Recalling his role in filmmaker Subhash Ghai's Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Pardes', which Salman Khan was interested in portraying, actor Apurva Agnihotri said, "It has nothing to do with my talent." "I've to thank Shatrughan Sinha's wife Punam...She got in touch with Mr Ghai," added Apurva. Ghai earlier said he refused to cast Salman as he needed someone who was stylish.

93.title: Karan offered me Bollywood film after Arjun Reddy, I was not ready then: Vijay
93.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda said that filmmaker Karan Johar offered him a Bollywood movie after watching 'Arjun Reddy'. "Then I was not ready, and now, we approached with Liger as it has the pan-India appeal. He supported us well in every aspect," he added. Vijay also spoke about his character in his upcoming movie 'Liger'.

94.title: No one else 'will be stupid enough' to play Test cricket past 40: Anderson
94.article_body: England's 40-year-old pacer James Anderson has said no one else will be "stupid enough" to play Test cricket past 40 in the future. "Everything that has gone in the world with franchise cricket...short forms of the game. I can't see anyone wanting to play Test cricket for this long," he added. Anderson is currently preparing to play his 173rd Test.

95.title: Sensex rises to 59,761 points, Nifty hits 17,775 in opening trade
95.article_body: Benchmark indices opened in green on Tuesday with Sensex and Nifty jumping 298.61 and 76.60 points, respectively. The Sensex opened at 59,761.39 points and Nifty at 17,774.80. Mahindra & Mahindra, Hero MotoCorp, Asian Paints, Eicher Motors and Britannia Industries were among the major Nifty gainers, while Grasim Industries, Hindalco Industries, Apollo Hospitals, Tata Steel and ONGC slipped.

96.title: WeWork Founder raises funds for new startup, reportedly at $1 billion valuation
96.article_body: WeWork Founder Adam Neumann has raised funds from Andreessen Horowitz for Flow, his new residential real estate company focused on rentals. According to The New York Times, Flow has raised $350 million from Andreessen Horowitz, marking the venture capital firm's largest individual check ever. Flow, which is yet to start operations, is reportedly valued at $1 billion after the fundraise.

97.title: Viral video shows Agra woman beating guard with stick, abusing him for ill-treating dogs
97.article_body: A video showing a woman beating a security guard with a stick and abusing him for allegedly mistreating dogs is going viral on social media. The man is reportedly an ex-serviceman working as a security guard in LIC Campus. Meanwhile, Agra Police said that they have launched an investigation into the incident.

98.title: Data of over one lakh members of a Mumbai club hacked
98.article_body: Data of over one lakh members of a club in Mumbai was recently hacked and put up on sale. The data included details like - names, mobile numbers, email IDs and business classification of members. The matter came to light after a few members received emails from unknown persons claiming to have shared the information online for ₹19,999.

99.title: William Ruto wins Kenya's Presidential election amid dispute
99.article_body: Deputy President William Ruto was on Monday declared the winner of Kenya's Presidential election amid violent protests and claims of rigging. Ruto had won 50.49% of the vote against rival Raila Odinga's 48.5%, according to the official results. Four of the seven members of the electoral commission have refused to endorse the result, saying it was "opaque".

100.title: A$AP Rocky charged with assault for allegedly firing at a former friend in LA last year
100.article_body: Rapper A$AP Rocky has been charged with assault with a firearm for allegedly firing twice at a former friend in Los Angeles last November. Earlier this month, A$AP Relli came forward as the person shot at by Rocky and said he plans to file a lawsuit. He alleged that Rocky lured him to an obscure location "to discuss a disagreement".

101.title: Doja Cat responds after social media users criticise her for shaving her head, eyebrows
101.article_body: American singer Doja Cat has responded to social media users who criticised her for shaving her head and eyebrows. "I won a Grammy and traveled the f***ing globe...I make hit after hit after hit and you all want me to look f***able for you...Go f**k yourselves," she tweeted. During an Instagram Live, Doja had said, "I never liked having hair."

102.title: 4 dead, 2 injured as truck rams into car on Delhi-Jaipur highway in Gurugram
102.article_body: At least four persons were killed and two were critically injured after a truck rammed into their car on the Delhi-Jaipur highway on Monday night in Haryana's Gurugram, police said. The accident took place within Bilaspur Police Station limits. "The deceased were residents of Delhi. Police took the bodies into their custody, the investigation [is] on," Gurugram Police added.

103.title: Thought 'Mind...' director was creepy uncle as he kept staring at me: Mini
103.article_body: Actress Mini Mathur recalled meeting 'Mind The Malhotras' director Sahil Sangha for the first time. She stated, "I was at lunch when I met Sahil...he kept looking at me and I was like...'Is he a creepy uncle?'" She added that Sahil said, "I'm going to talk to you about something." "The very next day he cast me," she concluded.

104.title: Kirsten just said 'Enjoy': Harbhajan on team meeting before 2011 WC final
104.article_body: Recalling the 2011 World Cup final against Sri Lanka, ex-India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh said the players were under "no pressure" before the match, with head coach Gary Kirsten simply asking them to "enjoy". Harbhajan had earlier revealed that captain MS Dhoni asked him to bowl around the wicket during the tournament's semi-final against Pakistan, helping him dismiss batter Umar Akmal.

105.title: Over 6 crore selfies with Tricolour uploaded on ‘Har Ghar Tiranga’ website
105.article_body: As many as 6,00,43,734 selfies with the Tricolour have been uploaded as of Tuesday morning on the 'Har Ghar Tiranga campaign' website as part of India's 76th Independence Day celebrations, according to the official website. Earlier, PM Narendra Modi gave a call to join the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' movement by hoisting or displaying the national flag at homes.

106.title: Bengaluru airport starts DigiYatra services for seamless travel
106.article_body: The beta version of the DigiYatra app was rolled out at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport on Independence Day. The service aims to provide a seamless experience to passengers using facial recognition technology at various checkpoints, including airport entry and aircraft boarding. The service is currently available only for Android users, with iOS launch planned for later.

107.title: Cyberabad Police forms special teams to regulate traffic, control crime
107.article_body: The Cyberabad Police has formed 'Traffic Task Force' teams to help regulate traffic movement on busy roads and control crime. Six teams comprising of two policemen each were flagged off by Cyberabad Police Commissioner Stephen Raveendra on Sunday. Each team has been provided with specially designed two wheeler with a public addressing system to ensure smooth flow of vehicular movement.

108.title: I can finally exhale: Model Padma Lakshmi on ex-husband Salman Rushdie's recovery
108.article_body: Indian-American model and author Padma Lakshmi tweeted about her ex-husband Salman Rushdie's recovery after he was stabbed in New York and wrote that she was worried and wordless and "can finally exhale". "Relieved [Salman Rushdie] is pulling through after Friday's nightmare...Now hoping for swift healing," she added. Earlier, Rushdie's agent said the 75-year-old is "on the road to recovery".

109.title: Woman cheated of ₹79 lakh on promise of restaurant franchise in Pune
109.article_body: A woman has filed a complaint after she was allegedly cheated of over ₹79 lakh on the promise of getting the franchise of a restaurant chain, a Pune police official said on Monday. Three accused, who were posing as the restaurant chain's representatives, had got the woman to transfer the amount into four accounts, a cyber police assistant inspector said.

110.title: 93-yr-old man, 87-yr-old wife die as roof of Mulund building collapses
110.article_body: A 93-year-old man and his 87-year-old wife lost their lives after the roof of a residential building in Maharashtra's Mulund collapsed on Monday. "The slab from the first-floor ceiling collapsed and the deceased senior citizens were the only people present at the time. The victims were rushed to the hospital, following which they were declared dead," an official said.

111.title: 100 yrs ago my father wasn't allowed to drink water, today 9-yr-old killed for it: Meira
111.article_body: Former Lok Sabha Speaker Meira Kumar on Monday tweeted, "100 years ago my father Babu Jagjivan Ram was prohibited from drinking water in school from the pitcher meant for Savarna Hindus...Today, a nine-year-old Dalit boy has been killed for the same reason." She added, "75 long years after Independence, caste system remains our greatest enemy."

112.title: Russia is ready to offer its most advanced weapons to allies: Putin
112.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has vowed to expand military cooperation with the country's allies in Latin America, Asia and Africa. "We're ready to offer our allies and partners the most advanced types of weapons, from firearms, armour and artillery to warplanes and drones," Putin said. He also hailed Russia's military operation in Ukraine and thanked Moscow's allies for their support.

113.title: Scaler announces to offer first class for free for all learners in Aug
113.article_body: Scaler announced that its 'Dare to Dream' session will be free for all learners in August. Hosted by Anshuman Singh, 'Dare to Dream' is Scaler's first online classroom session, helping learners to gain understanding of different careers, interviews, and learning materials for excelling in tech domain. With 94% placement rate, Scaler has placed 2500+ learners in tech roles, it stated.

114.title: Bengaluru reports 870 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
114.article_body: Bengaluru reported 870 new COVID-19 infections in a day, taking the cumulative total to 18,52,818 cases, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said on Monday. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,979. The number of active cases was 6,951, while the infection positivity rate stood at 6.83%.

115.title: Hyderabad civic body converts dumping sites into food street
115.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has converted the roadside, which was once used as dumping grounds, into a food street. The initiative has been taken up to create employment opportunities for youth. "Earlier the road was bad and later the MLA cleaned it and put up...stalls. I was unemployed and now I got the stall," a beneficiary said.

116.title: 1 dead after column collapses at Air Force Station in Delhi Cantt
116.article_body: One labourer died and four others were injured after a column they were constructing collapsed inside the Air Force Station in the Delhi Cantt area. Following the incident, the labourers claimed that they'd asked for safety equipment but were denied. The deceased's wife alleged that the employers didn't help and her husband died because he wasn't taken to a hospital.

117.title: Former Bihar minister and BJP MLA Subhash Singh dies aged 59
117.article_body: Former Bihar minister and BJP MLA Subhash Singh passed away aged 59 on Tuesday at Delhi's AIIMS. "Received the sad news of the demise of Shri Subhash Singh ji from Gopalganj Sadar. Praying to God to give his soul a place at his feet...Peace," Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav tweeted. Singh was undergoing treatment at AIIMS for over a month.

118.title: FIFA suspends All India Football Federation with immediate effect
118.article_body: World football governing body FIFA has suspended the All India Football Federation (AIFF) with immediate effect due to undue influence from third parties. The suspension will be lifted once the AIFF administration regains full control of the AIFF's daily affairs, FIFA stated. Further, Under-17 Women's World Cup 2022 cannot be held in India in October as currently planned, FIFA added.

119.title: Doja Cat responds after social media users criticise her for shaving her head, eyebrows
119.article_body: American singer Doja Cat has responded to social media users who criticised her for shaving her head and eyebrows. "I won a Grammy and traveled the f***ing globe...I make hit after hit after hit and you all want me to look f***able for you...Go f**k yourselves," she tweeted. During an Instagram Live, Doja had said, "I never liked having hair."

120.title: I can finally exhale: Model Padma Lakshmi on ex-husband Salman Rushdie's recovery
120.article_body: Indian-American model and author Padma Lakshmi tweeted about her ex-husband Salman Rushdie's recovery after he was stabbed in New York and wrote that she was worried and wordless and "can finally exhale". "Relieved [Salman Rushdie] is pulling through after Friday's nightmare...Now hoping for swift healing," she added. Earlier, Rushdie's agent said the 75-year-old is "on the road to recovery".

121.title: PM Modi pays floral tribute to Atal Bihari Vajpayee on his death anniversary
121.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid floral tribute to former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee on his death anniversary at Sadaiv Atal (Vajpayee's memorial) in New Delhi. PM Modi was accompanied by other BJP leaders including Union Home Minister Amit Shah. Vajpayee, who was India's PM for six years (1998-2004), died in 2018 at 93 years of age.

122.title: Bhopal schools to remain closed today due to heavy rainfall
122.article_body: The District Collector of Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal has directed for all schools in the state to remain closed on Tuesday. The decision has been taken in view of incessant rainfall in the area, news agency ANI reported. Reports had earlier said that water level of various dams in Madhya Pradesh has increased substantially due to the rainfall.

123.title: Social Justice Dept officials to stay in 441 Maha hostels to improve them
123.article_body: In a bid to improve the condition of hostels run by the Social Justice Department in Maharashtra, the department officials will be staying overnight at all 441 such hostels in the state, reports said. The officials will eat the dinner served to students, sleep in hostel rooms and use facilities that are being offered to students.

124.title: Apple sets Sept 5 deadline for employees to start returning to office 3 days a week
124.article_body: Apple has set a September 5 deadline for its corporate employees to be in the office at least three days per week, according to internal emails. The company will require employees to work from the office on Tuesdays, Thursdays and a third day determined by individual teams. Apple's hybrid work model, announced in June 2021, was delayed earlier this year.

125.title: Delhi witnesses less than 2,000 new COVID cases for 1st time in 12 days
125.article_body: Delhi on Monday reported 1,227 new COVID-19 cases and eight coronavirus-related deaths. This is the first time in 12 days that the daily COVID-19 cases in Delhi have been below the 2,000 mark. Notably, the daily COVID-19 positivity rate in the national capital has risen to 14.57%, compared to 12.64% on Sunday. Delhi has witnessed 19,85,822 COVID-19 cases since 2020.

126.title: Kylian Mbappe calls Messi and Ronaldo 'the greedy two'
126.article_body: PSG forward Kylian Mbappe said the Ballon d'Or award was "crushed by the greedy two", Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo. "Frankly, everything is crushed by the greedy two...that battle was pretty crazy," he said. When asked to choose between the two, Mbappe said that he couldn't as it would be like choosing between a father or mother.

127.title: 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign boosted sales of Tricolour: Traders
127.article_body: To commemorate 75 years of Indian independence, the Centre launched the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign which helped increase the demand and sales of the tricolour, traders and flag makers said. "There has been unprecedented demand for the national flag this year...We have already supplied 10 lakh pieces of the national flag," said Mumbai-based The Flag Company's Co-founder Dalvir Singh Nagi.

128.title: Kashmiris threatened to hoist national flag: Mehbooba Mufti
128.article_body: Former J&K CM and Peoples Democratic Party President Mehbooba Mufti said that people in Kashmir were threatened and made to hoist the Tricolour. In a series of tweets, she said, "J&K administration shamelessly boasts about Kashmiris hoisting Indian flag. Truth is they were threatened to do so or else face the consequences." She called the government's patriotism "pseudo and monetised".

129.title: Senior Kenyan election officials disown presidential poll results
129.article_body: The deputy chairperson of Kenya's election commission and three other commissioners on Monday disassociated themselves with the results of the recently concluded presidential elections. "We are not able to take ownership of the results that will be announced," deputy chairperson Juliana Cherera announced. This came shortly before the announcement of the results by the election commission.

130.title: Suryakumar is a bit like De Villiers, no. 4 is his best batting spot: Ponting
130.article_body: Comparing India batter Suryakumar Yadav with AB de Villiers, Ricky Ponting said the India batter scores 360 degrees around the ground, a bit like the ex-South African cricketer. "The lap shots, the late cuts...the ramps over the keeper's head," he added. Talking about Suryakumar's batting spot in India's squad, Ponting said number four is the 31-year-old's best spot.

131.title: Namibian cheetahs to be brought to MP given health checkups
131.article_body: Cheetahs from Namibia, which could soon be settled into Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park, were given their first health check-up by an international team of experts. The Indian High Commission in Windhoek tweeted photos of the animals undergoing the examination. Last month, India signed an MoU with Namibia to reintroduce the animals back into the wild.

132.title: Used to prepare the night before, getting our kites ready: Kohli on I-Day childhood memory
132.article_body: Talking about his childhood memories of Independence Day, Virat Kohli said, "In Delhi...there's a big culture of flying kites on 15th August...so that used to be a super special moment." He added, "We all used to prepare a lot the night before, getting our kites and everything ready...so that we can find a good time and go to fly kites."

133.title: What are the features of the Made-in-India howitzer used for I-Day gun salute?
133.article_body: The Made-in-India howitzer ATAGS was used in the customary 21-gun salute during the Independence Day ceremony for the first time ever at the Red Fort on Monday. The long-range artillery gun with a 48-km maximum range was developed by DRDO. It has advanced features ensuring quick deployability, high mobility, an automatic command and control system and an advanced communication system.

134.title: Shakira to relocate to Miami amid tax fraud claims: Reports
134.article_body: Pop star Shakira is reportedly leaving Spain to relocate to Miami amid the alleged tax fraud case. Her family friend and Douglas Elliman realtor Ana Lourdes Martinez described Miami as Shakira's "refuge". Shakira is accused of failing to pay taxes between 2012 and 2014, a period during which she claimed she was living in the Bahamas.

135.title: More than deserved: Alcaraz on fellow Spaniard Busta's 1st 1000 Masters title
135.article_body: Following Spaniard Pablo Carreño Busta's maiden ATP 1000 Masters title in Montreal, compatriot Carlos Alcaraz said, "Pablo!!!! Congratulations and more than deserved! Happy for you!" Argentina's Diego Schwartzman said, "Giant pablito. A great partner/friend...Congratulations." Busta beat Hubert Hurkacz 3-6, 6-3, 6-3 in Sunday's final. Busta is the sixth Spaniard to win an ATP Tour title this year.

136.title: CWG 2022 medal winners from Haryana to be honoured on Aug 16
136.article_body: The Commonwealth Games 2022 medal winners from Haryana will be honoured by the state government in Gurugram on Tuesday. The gold, silver and bronze medallists will be awarded ₹1.5 crore, ₹75 lakh and ₹50 lakh respectively. However, all participating athletes from Haryana will get ₹7.5 lakh. Notably, Haryana's sportspersons won 20 medals, including nine gold medals, in CWG 2022.

137.title: Stoinis to not face sanction for accusing Pak bowler Hasnain of chucking
137.article_body: Australian cricketer Marcus Stoinis will not face any formal sanction for questioning Pakistani pacer Mohammad Hasnain's bowling action during their match in The Hundred. Stoinis was spoken to by match referee Dean Cosker after the incident. The controversy took place after Hasnain took Stoinis' wicket with a quicker delivery during the match.

138.title: Snapchat+ crosses 1 million paid subscribers within 6 weeks from launch
138.article_body: Snapchat's parent company, Snap Inc, on Monday said that the company's paid subscription plan Snapchat+, which launched in June, now has over one million subscribers across the globe. According to a report, Snap had registered $7.3 million in in-app revenue within 30 days of Snapchat+ launch. Snap also introduced four new features for Snapchat+.

139.title: Arsene Wenger names Henry among his 7 favourite Arsenal players
139.article_body: Arsenal's longest-serving manager Arsene Wenger named seven players when he was asked to name his favourite player from his time with the club. Thierry Henry, Dennis Bergkamp, Patrick Vieira, Robert Pires, Jack Wilshere, Aaron Ramsey and Cesc Fabregas were the players Wenger mentioned. Wenger had managed the London club from 1996 to 2018.

140.title: ICC needs to put more time to ensure ODI, Test survival: Kapil Dev
140.article_body: Former India captain Kapil Dev urged the ICC to put more time into ensuring survival of ODI and Test cricket. "I think it's fading out...ICC has to put more time...(to) ensure survival of one-day cricket, Test match cricket," said Kapil Dev. He said he fears international cricket would be played only during the World Cup.

141.title: Honoured to receive your I-Day wishes: PM Modi to Mauritius PM
141.article_body: After being wished on the occasion of India completing its 75 years of Independence, PM Narendra Modi thanked Mauritius Prime Minister Pravind Kumar Jugnauth. "Honoured to receive your Independence Day wishes. India and Mauritius have very deep cultural linkages. Our nations are also cooperating in a wide range of subjects for the mutual benefit of our citizens," PM Modi said.

142.title: All Australians applaud India’s successes: Aus PM Anthony Albanese
142.article_body: Australian PM Anthony Albanese wished India on completing 75 years of Independence and said that "all Australians applaud India's successes". "We also give thanks for the contribution of our Indian-Australian community to our society...and to the links between our nations," he said. Meanwhile, PM Narendra Modi replied, "The friendship between India and Australia has stood the test of time."

143.title: Tourist ban shouldn't make life harder for Kremlin critics: Germany
143.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Monday said that any decision regarding a proposed entry ban on Russian tourists in EU should not make it harder for critics of Russian leadership to flee the country. Several EU leaders have called for a ban on the entry of Russian tourists into the bloc's territory over the ongoing invasion of Ukraine by Russia.

144.title: Pietersen sends I-Day wishes to Indian fans through tweet in Hindi, fans correct him
144.article_body: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen took to Twitter to wish his Indian fans on India's 76th Independence Day in Hindi. Several fans pointed out mistakes in his tweet, with one saying, "Please don't use Google Translate." Another wrote, "Stand tall doesn't equate to 'lamba khade raho'...but we got your emotions." Another user mentioned it's India's 76th Independence Day not 75th.

145.title: Meta partners with DoorDash for delivery of Marketplace items in US: Reports
145.article_body: Online delivery platform DoorDash and Meta have partnered to deliver Facebook Marketplace items in US. The items will only be delivered within a radius of 25 km and need to be small enough to fit in the trunk of a car. Currently, it has not been made clear how much it would cost to use DoorDash to make the deliveries.

146.title: Criticism of judiciary must be within bounds: India's next Chief Justice
146.article_body: India's next Chief Justice Uday Umesh Lalit on Monday said, "The public has the right to see whether our judgments are up to the expectations of society or not." However, he added, there must be a line that should be drawn. "Any criticism is a pointer that even...judiciary can do...course corrections...but that criticism should be within bounds," he added.

147.title: CA aiming for cricket's inclusion at Brisbane Olympics in 2032
147.article_body: Cricket Australia is aiming to include cricket in the 2032 Brisbane Olympics. The target is part of a five-year strategic plan named 'Where the Game Grows', which includes nine targets. "This strategy contains both a vision and a clear plan for how we can achieve bold, transformative change while also meeting our core responsibilities," CA CEO Nick Hockley said.

148.title: Johnny Depp to direct first film after 25 years
148.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp will be directing Italian painter Amedeo Modigliani's biopic, which reportedly will be co-produced by Al Pacino. The film will be his first direction in 25 years after 'The Brave' (1997). The actor said he is "incredibly honoured, humbled" to bring Modigliani's story on screen. He called it a story of "great hardship, but eventual triumph".

149.title: No one can ignore Savarkar's role in India's freedom struggle: Sena MP
149.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi said nobody can ignore Vinayak Damodar Savarkar's role in India's freedom struggle and added that India runs on the energy and principles of Mahatma Gandhi. "Every contribution by different freedom fighters played a significant role in independence," she said. "If PM Narendra Modi mentioned Gandhi's name, I hope he follows his path too," she added.

150.title: PM took Mahatma Gandhi's name, hope he follows his path: Shiv Sena MP
150.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi on Monday took a swipe at PM Narendra Modi, saying she hopes he follows the path of Mahatma Gandhi as he mentioned 'Bapu' in his Independence Day address. She said that the role played by VD Savarkar can't be ignored, adding that every freedom fighter's contribution played a significant role in India's independence.

151.title: EV startup Faraday Future to raise funding of $600 mn
151.article_body: Electric Vehicle startup Faraday Future Intelligent Electric Inc said that it will raise funding of $600 million. As part of a new financing facility, the startup will receive an $52 million of committed funds. The EV maker said that it is in talks with investors in US and globally for additional near-term funding.

152.title: Civil aviation sector's safety, security is paramount: Scindia
152.article_body: Union Minister for Civil Aviation Jyotiraditya Scindia has said that the safety and security of the country's civil aviation space is "paramount". "We make sure that every occurrence is reported," Scindia said. He added, "For both safety and security, we have the regulators in place that monitor compliance on those parameters. BCAS for security and DGCA for safety."

153.title: US sanctions 3 Liberian officials including President's top aide
153.article_body: The US imposed sanctions on three government officials of Liberia on Monday for their alleged involvement in "ongoing public corruption", the Treasury Department informed. One of the sanctioned individuals is President George Weah's chief of staff, Nathaniel McGill. "These officials have undermined democracy in Liberia for their own personal benefit," a senior Treasury Department official stated.

154.title: American billionaire investor Daniel Loeb's Third Point re-invests in Disney
154.article_body: American billionaire investor Daniel Loeb's hedge fund Third Point has announced a new stake in Disney, months after it partially liquidated its stake in the firm. In a letter to Disney CEO, Loeb also suggested a slew of changes, including a spin-off of its sports network ESPN, reports said on Monday. Shares of Disney reportedly jumped 2% on the news.

155.title: Omicron-specific COVID-19 vaccine for India expected in 6 months: SII's Poonawalla
155.article_body: Serum Institute of India's (SII) CEO Adar Poonawalla has said that a COVID-19 vaccine that specifically targets the Omicron variant is expected in India in the next six months, reports said on Monday. SII is the world's biggest vaccine maker and it manufactures the Oxford/AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine, sold as Covishield in India.

156.title: Harshal Patel shares video from injury rehab, says 'Back to the grind'
156.article_body: Pacer Harshal Patel, who was ruled out of India's Asia Cup 2022 squad due to a rib injury, posted a video on Instagram undergoing rehabilitation at National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru. "Back to the grind!! Sometimes the silver lining with injury is that it allows you the time to train without thinking about competition, which is precious," he wrote.

157.title: Will you hit the streets if CBI comes for me?: WB CM to TMC cadre
157.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee at a rally on Sunday asked TMC supporters if they would hit the streets if the CBI reaches her doorstep. "What will you do if they reach my house tomorrow? Will you not hit the streets?" asked Mamata to the crowd. Bengal BJP asked if her statement was an "admission of involvement in corruption".

158.title: India donates 15,000 cycles to Madagascar on 76th Independence Day
158.article_body: On the occasion of India's 76th Independence Day, India has donated 15,000 cycles to Madagascar "as a symbol of growing cooperation" between the countries, Indian Embassy in Madagascar said. India announced the donation on June 3, which is World Bicycle Day. Meanwhile, the Town Hall in Madagascar's Antananarivo had also lit up in tricolour to mark India's independence.

159.title: Man throws bomb after clash between 2 families; 12-yr-old dead, 15 injured
159.article_body: A 12-year-old boy died while 15 people were injured after a man threw a bomb at a rival group during a clash between two families in Madhya Pradesh's Indore district, police said on Monday. Police later raided several houses in the area to find out if there were more bombs. Of the injured persons, the condition of four is critical.

160.title: Ballia man allegedly kills woman with sword for slapping him
160.article_body: A man in UP's Ballia allegedly killed a woman with a sword on Sunday night after she reportedly insulted and slapped him. The police said that the accused surrendered, along with the murder weapon and has been identified as Dilshad Ali Sonu. The victim's family members were also hurt during the attack and are undergoing treatment.

161.title: Tricolour hoisted atop Malkangiri's Maoist memorial for the 1st time
161.article_body: Residents of the tribal-dominated Swabhiman Anchal in Odisha's Malkangiri celebrated Independence Day by hoisting the tricolour at the memorials of Maoist leaders for the first time ever. Earlier, Maoists would hoist black flags in the area as security personnel could not venture into the region. On Monday, security forces also took out a bike rally to celebrate the day.

162.title: Tamil actor Kanal Kannan arrested for provocative speech on Periyar
162.article_body: Tamil actor and stunt choreographer Kanal Kannan, who is also a functionary of the Hindu Munnani, was arrested on Monday for making provocative remarks about Dravidian ideologue EVR Periyar at a gathering in Chennai. In his speech, he sought the demolition of the Periyar statue outside Sri Ranganathar Swamy Temple in Srirangam. Kannan was arrested from Puducherry.

163.title: Karan Johar shares video of his children singing 'Hum Honge Kamyab' on I-Day
163.article_body: Director Karan Johar celebrated the 76th Independence Day with his twins Yash and Roohi. The filmmaker shared a video on Instagram in which his kids were seen singing 'Hum Honge Kamyab'. Along with the video, Karan wrote that the future of India "rests in very stable hands". He said the next generation has the "ultimate power of uniting the nation".

164.title: EAM Jaishankar condoles the loss of lives in Egyptian church fire
164.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Monday extended condolences to the families of the victims of the fire tragedy that claimed the lives of 41 people in a church in Egypt on Sunday. "Wish a speedy recovery to those injured," he further stated. According to the Egyptian health ministry, 55 people were injured in the incident.

165.title: Snapchat+ adds 4 new features including priority Story replies, post view emoji
165.article_body: Snapchat+, the paid version of the social media app Snapchat, has added four more paid features to the service. The new features include priority Story replies, post view emoji, new Bitmoji backgrounds and new custom app icons. These are in addition to the existing seven features like best friends forever, friend solar system, Snapchat messaging on the web, among others.

166.title: ​Russia ready to arm its allies with modern weapons: Vladimir Putin
166.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Monday that Moscow values its ties with countries in Latin America, Asia and Africa and is ready to offer ammunition to its allies. "[We] are ready to offer our allies the most modern types of weapons, from small arms to armored vehicles and artillery to combat aviation and unmanned aerial vehicles," Putin said.

167.title: Shami's estranged wife dances on 'Des Rangila', urges PM Modi to change India's name
167.article_body: Team India fast bowler Mohammad Shami's estranged wife Hasin Jahan took to Instagram to share a video of herself dancing on 'Des Rangila' on the occasion of Independence Day. She urged PM Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah to change India's name, stating that the country should only be known as "Bharat" or "Hindustan".

168.title: To be a true Indian is to help others: Sonu Sood
168.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood said that Independence Day reminds people of their duties as Indians. He added that a true Indian is someone who helps others. "To be a true Indian you have to help Indians. Bring a change, bring a smile, and try to save a life," he said. Recently, Sonu announced his audio series 'Commander Karan Saxena'.

169.title: Du Plessis wishes India on I-Day, says 'You are my special home away from home'
169.article_body: On the occasion of India's 76th Independence Day, ex-South Africa captain Faf Du Plessis tweeted, "You are my special home away from home. Congratulations on 75 not out." Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen took to Twitter and wrote, "Be proud and stand tall. You are building a better tomorrow for all!" India is celebrating the 75th anniversary of its independence.

170.title: Nadal not included in Spain squad for Davis Cup, Zverev to lead Germany
170.article_body: Rafael Nadal, who is making his comeback from injury this week, has not been named in Spain's Davis Cup finals group stage squad for next month. Teenager Carlos Alcaraz replaces Nadal in the team. Meanwhile, world number two Alexander Zverev will be leading the German side as he makes a comeback from the ankle injury he picked up in June.

171.title: Mumbai-based The Health Factory raises ₹2 crore in seed funding
171.article_body: Mumbai-based food brand, The Health Factory, has raised ₹2 crore in a seed funding round. The capital was raised from Venture Garage, Happilo founder Vikas Nahar and other angel investors. Founded by Vinay Maheshwari, Jos Vast and Mohit Sankhala, the FMCG company will use the funds raised to scale and streamline operations and take its business to other cities.

172.title: Children and homeless: Kanye West on his biggest inspiration for design
172.article_body: Rapper-designer Kanye West, now formally known as Ye, revealed his inspiration behind his fashion label, Yeezy. He took to his Instagram account on Friday and shared a post that read, "Look to the children/ Look to the homeless as the biggest inspiration for all design." Yeezy is a collaboration between Ye and sportswear company Adidas.

173.title: Starbucks asks labour board to suspend voting for union elections
173.article_body: Starbucks has asked the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) to suspend all union elections at its US stores alleging voter misconduct by NLRB officials and the union. Starbucks said that a  whistleblower called out NLRB officials for acting inappropriately during the Kansas City elections. The company wants to pause mail-in elections and asked all future elections to be held in-person.

174.title: Vignesh Shivan, Nayanthara celebrate I-Day in Spain, share pic
174.article_body: Tamil actress Nayanthara celebrated India's 76th Independence Day in Spain with her husband and filmmaker Vignesh Shivan. The filmmaker shared the photos on his Instagram profile.
