The pictures show Nayanthara and Vignesh posing with the Tricolour. Later, the actress was also seen enjoying a live performance on the streets of Barcelona.

175.title: Mahindra signs deal with Volkswagen to receive electric vehicle components
175.article_body: Mahindra & Mahindra has signed a term sheet with Volkswagen Group under which it will receive components for its electric vehicles. The cooperation aims at parts for over 1 million vehicles till 2030 and includes equipment of 5 electric SUVs. Mahindra expects 20-30% of its total SUV sales from its electric models by March 2027.

176.title: All 11 life imprisonment convicts in Bilkis Bano gang-rape case released from jail
176.article_body: All 11 life imprisonment convicts in the Bilkis Bano gang-rape case were released from the Godhra sub-jail under the remission policy of the Gujarat government. "A committee formed a few months back took a unanimous decision in favour of remission of all the 11 convicts in the case," Panchmahals collector Sujal Mayatra said. Mayatra headed the panel.

177.title: Sultan Azlan Shah Cup hockey tournament to return after 2 years due to COVID
177.article_body: Sultan Azlan Shah Cup hockey tournament is scheduled to return after a two-year gap due to the COVID-19 pandemic. It will be held in Malaysia from November 16 to 25. World number one Australia, Germany, India, New Zealand and Canada have been invited to the tournament. India have won Sultan Azlan Shah Cup five times.

178.title: I-Day would've been better if India was free from poverty: Mayawati
178.article_body: BSP supremo Mayawati on Monday said Independence Day celebrations would have been better if the country was free from "inflation, fatal poverty, unemployment, illiteracy and health problems". She also called for a pledge to wash away the ills of casteism, communalism, hateful politics and corruption. Mayawati said India has a constitutional responsibility toward the welfare of its people.

179.title: 6 Bihar policemen suspended after jailed ex-RJD leader seen at home
179.article_body: Six Bihar Police officials were immediately suspended after a picture showing ex-RJD leader Anand Mohan, who is serving a life sentence, with his family members surfaced on social media. Mohan, who is lodged at Saharsa jail in Bihar, was brought to Patna on August 12 to be produced in the civil court. Mohan's son Chetan Anand is an RJD MLA.

180.title: Sergio Perez will not replace Lewis Hamilton: Mercedes boss Wolff
180.article_body: Mercedes F1 boss Toto Wolff has rubbished rumours of Red Bull's Sergio Perez replacing seven-time world champion Lewis Hamilton in the team. "I've never called Sergio...and haven't been in contact with any other driver," said Wolff. He added that there were discussions with Hamilton to continue with the team for five or even 10 years.

181.title: Citizens' freedom can't be taken away: Siddique Kappan's daughter
181.article_body: On the occasion of India's 76th Independence Day, the nine-year-old daughter of Malayali journalist Siddique Kappan, booked and jailed under UAPA in the Hathras rape case, said that ordinary citizens' freedom can't be taken away. I am the daughter of a journalist who is being denied basic rights available to all citizens, she said.

182.title: Nitish is an amarbel, can't be a tree: Giriraj Singh on Nitish's 20 yrs as CM
182.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar will break record of being CM for 20 years but he's like an "amarbel" (dodder) that'll never become a tree, Union Minister Giriraj Singh said on Monday. "BJP made him CM last year. I challenge Nitish to form his own government," Singh added. Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav used to call Kumar 'Paltu Chacha', Singh said.

183.title: Death toll in Armenian market explosion rises to 6
183.article_body: The death toll in the explosion that ripped through a market in Armenia's capital Yerevan on Sunday has risen to six, the Armenian government said on Monday. According to authorities, 18 people remain missing and at least 61 others have been reported injured. The explosion, that reportedly occurred at a fireworks storage area, started a fire in the Surmalu market.

184.title: Need 5 yrs to change system; did it in Delhi, can do it for India: Kejriwal
184.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said his party "just [needs] five years [to]...change the entire system, from education to health, in the country". "Today, people are asking...why India is still behind several countries...even those that got freedom after us," Kejriwal further said. He also asked Opposition parties to not call schemes provided to ordinary citizens as "freebies".

185.title: Singer Rahul Jain accused of raping costume stylist in his flat after meeting via Insta
185.article_body: An FIR has been registered against Bollywood singer-composer Rahul Jain for allegedly raping a 30-year-old costume stylist in his flat in Mumbai. As per the complaint, Rahul met the costume stylist through Instagram where he praised her work and offered her to become his personal costume stylist. The woman stated that Jain assaulted her when she resisted him.

186.title: Manchester City's Mendy raped women in locked rooms in his UK mansion, court told
186.article_body: Manchester City footballer Benjamin Mendy allegedly locked women in rooms with complicated panic room-style locks and raped them, a UK court was told during a trial against him. The 28-year-old has been accused of raping and sexually assaulting seven different women at his "isolated" UK mansion. Mendy committed the alleged offences with the help of his 'fixer' Louis Matturie.

187.title: TRS leader, who switched from CPI(M), hacked to death in Telangana
187.article_body: TRS leader Tammineni Krishnaiah was hacked to death by assailants in Telangana's Khammam on Monday. The 55-year-old politician, who was murdered shortly after hoisting the tricolour, had recently switched to the TRS from CPI(M). Notably, Telangana CPI(M) Secretary Thammineni Veerabhadram, who happens to be Krishnaiah's cousin, has been accused by his relatives of orchestrating the crime.

188.title: If there's one thing he does not lack is his confidence: Karthik on Shardul
188.article_body: Praising India all-rounder Shardul Thakur, teammate Dinesh Karthik said, "If there's one thing he does not lack is his confidence." He added that what he liked about the 30-year-old was that he had taken "300 domestic wickets" before playing Test cricket and he was able to transfer the confidence of playing at the domestic level to the international level.

189.title: Haven't watched Umran much but his ability to bowl fast is impressive: McGrath
189.article_body: Speaking about India pacer Umran Malik, who consistently bowls over 150 kmph, Glenn McGrath stated, "Haven't seen a huge amount of Umran, but the fact that he can bowl at a good pace is impressive." On fast bowling, McGrath said, "Sheer pace is unique. You can't teach someone to bowl 150-plus, they've got to be able to naturally do that."

190.title: So proud to have India as my adopted country: Arjun Kanungo's South African wife Carla
190.article_body: South African model Carla Dennis, who recently tied the knot with Indian singer Arjun Kanungo, took to Instagram to wish India on its 76th Independence Day. She wrote, "I’m soon to be an Indian citizen and I’m so proud to have you as my adopted country for your incomparable warmth, cultural diversity and scrumptious food."

191.title: Ex-India football head coach uploads incorrect India map on I-Day, apologises
191.article_body: Former Indian men's football team head coach Stephen Constantine uploaded an incorrect India map to wish the nation on its 76th Independence day. The 59-year-old, however, corrected himself on being called out by fans and deleted the tweet. He then tweeted again, writing, "Apologies on the incorrect map posted earlier....Happy Independence Day to Indians the world over."

192.title: Ravindra Jadeja completely out of touch with CSK, likely to leave the team: Reports
192.article_body: All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has been completely "out of touch" with CSK management since the conclusion of IPL 2022 and is likely to leave the franchise, as per reports. Jadeja was made CSK captain ahead of IPL 2022 but he left the role midway. He also deleted CSK-related posts from his social media accounts.

193.title: Aadhaar, DBT helped save ₹2 lakh crore from falling into wrong hands: PM Modi
193.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, in his Independence Day speech said that Aadhaar and Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) have helped in saving ₹2 lakh crore from falling into wrong hands in the last eight years. He added, "Those who fled India after looting banks during the tenure of the previous government, we've seized their property and are trying to get them back."

194.title: UP family receives death threats for distributing national flags
194.article_body: A family received death threats for allegedly distributing tricolours on the occasion of Independence Day in Bijnor, Uttar Pradesh on Monday. An unidentified suspect pasted a threat letter outside the residence of Shashi and her husband Arun, police said. After the incident, the family has been provided police protection and an FIR has been lodged.

195.title: 4 booked after rape victim dies during forced abortion in Varanasi
195.article_body: A case has been registered against four individuals for the alleged death of a 22-year-old woman during a forced abortion in Varanasi, police said on Monday. The accused include a driver, his friend, a private hospital's senior official, and a doctor. The driver had allegedly raped the woman, and took her to the private hospital for abortion, as per police.

196.title: Deposed Myanmar leader Suu Kyi sentenced to 6 more years in prison
196.article_body: A Myanmar court on Monday convicted deposed leader Aung San Suu Kyi on additional corruption charges, increasing her earlier 11-year prison sentence by six more years. She was convicted for allegedly abusing her power to rent public land at below-market prices and building a residence with donation money. The trial was held behind closed doors, with no access to media.

197.title: Biggest challenge for Australia is winning Test series in India: McGrath
197.article_body: Ex-Australia pacer Glenn McGrath said the biggest challenge for the Australian team is coming to India and beating the home team in the Test series. "We were lucky enough to do it in 2004. You've got to come up with good plans," he added. Australia will tour India for a four-match Test series in February-March 2023.

198.title: 2 teenagers drown while crossing river in Manali
198.article_body: Two teenagers drowned while crossing a river in Himachal Pradesh on Monday. The deceased, identified as Krishit (13) and Rahul (14), died while crossing a culvert over a river in Solang in Kullu's Manali town, police said. Krishit was a resident of Ghoshal village, while Rahul was a resident of Haripur village, police added.

199.title: India, China shouldn't let their politics affect neighbours: Ex-Bhutan PM
199.article_body: Bhutan's ex-PM Tshering Tobgay on Sunday said that India and China shouldn't allow their politics to affect countries "sandwiched" between them. "As long as there’s interference in...internal affairs in the neighbouring countries, I...believe that these countries will find it exceedingly difficult to grow," he added. Separately, Tobgay said that India should be offered a permanent seat in UNSC.

200.title: Pics showing Ambani's Antilia decorated with lights on Independence Day go viral
200.article_body: Pictures and videos of billionaire industrialist Mukesh Ambani's Mumbai residence Antilia decorated with Independence Day-themed lights have gone viral on Twitter. The decorations feature Tricolour and Ashoka Chakra lights. The government had launched the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign to mark 75 years of India's Independence this year and urged people to install Tricolours at home.

201.title: BJP believes it has exclusive right over nationalism: Warring
201.article_body: Punjab Congress President Amarinder Singh Warring said that the "BJP believes it has exclusive right over nationalism". "PM Narendra Modi should have called an all-party meeting and announced a non-partisan programme [for the 76th Independence Day]," Warring said. He also criticised former Congress MLA Sunil Jakhar and accused him of "betraying" Congress in the last Punjab Assembly polls.

202.title: 80-yr-old man falls from terrace while hoisting flag in UP, dies
202.article_body: An 80-year-old man fell to his death while trying to hoist the tricolour on his terrace in UP's Muzaffarnagar on Sunday. The victim, Atmaram Sharma, was keen to participate in government's 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign and was a fitness enthusiast, his family said. He lost his balance while trying to tie the flag to a pole and then fell down.

203.title: 2 groups clash during Tiranga Yatra in UP on I-Day, 1 injured
203.article_body: Two groups clashed during a Tiranga Yatra in the Bangla Bazar area of Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow on Independence Day on Monday. A person received minor injuries in the incident and some cars were also damaged, the police said. They added that a group of men from the first yatra pelted stones on the second over some old rivalry.

204.title: Ambassador of France to India asks French people what they love about India, shares video
204.article_body: With India and France completing 75 years of diplomatic ties, Emmanuel Lenain, Ambassador of France to India, took to Twitter to share a video wherein French people were asked what they love about India. In the video, a respondent said, "Jugaad is very important in India. Indians always find a solution." "The culture, the colours, the chaos," said another.

205.title: Federalism with diversity is the foundation of India: Kerala CM
205.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan, in his Independence Day Speech, said, "Federalism laced with rich diversity is the foundation of India." He added that Indian nationalism's "most striking" feature was that it could integrate all languages and cultures. CM Vijayan said the state was moving towards eradicating extreme poverty, the digital divide and addressing the issues of the homeless.

206.title: Rajasthan MLA Panachand Meghwal resigns after 9-yr-old Dalit boy beaten to death
206.article_body: Rajasthan Congress MLA Panachand Meghwal resigned from Atru Assembly seat in Baran district on Monday after a nine-year-old Dalit boy was beaten to death by his school teacher for drinking water from his pot in Jalore. Meghwal said he was deeply hurt by the incident. Meghwal added, "Dalits and deprived communities are being subjected to constant atrocities and torture."

207.title: US' KKR to sell entire 27% stake in Max Healthcare on Tue, to raise ₹9,000 cr
207.article_body: US private equity firm KKR will be selling its entire 27% stake in hospital chain Max Healthcare on Tuesday (August 16) and is likely to raise ₹9,000 crore through the transaction. KKR would be offloading 26.7 crore shares at a price band of ₹350-361.9/share, according to deal terms released on Monday. KKR had acquired the stake in 2018 for ₹80/share.

208.title: Shoppers flee Ikea in China as officials try to lock them in store over COVID-19 scare
208.article_body: A video of shoppers fleeing an Ikea store in China's Shanghai after orders of a sudden lockdown in the store has gone viral online. Shoppers were ordered to be locked down at Ikea after authorities found out that a close contact of a 6-year-old boy, who's an asymptomatic COVID-19 patient, had visited it. Guards were seen restraining the fleeing crowd.

209.title: You amaze me every day, my wonder-Astra: Alia to Ayan on b'day
209.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt wished 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji on his birthday. Sharing some behind-the-scene photos of herself and Ayan from the sets of the upcoming film, Alia wrote, "Happy birthday my wonder-Astra. You amaze me every day! I love you so much." She also wished him "love and light for life". 'Brahmastra' marks Alia's first film with Ayan.

210.title: Took strictest action: Domino's India on viral pics of mops hanging above pizza dough
210.article_body: Domino's India responded after purported pictures of cleaning mops and a toilet brush hanging above trays of pizza dough at one of its outlets in Bengaluru went viral on Twitter. Calling it a "month-old issue", it said that this was an isolated incident and that it had taken the "strictest action against the restaurant in question".

211.title: Want independence from people's judgements: Rashami Desai
211.article_body: On the 76th Independence Day, Rashami Desai said she would like freedom from "the judgemental nature of society", especially on a celebrity's personal life. She said that people need to accept that even celebrities are humans who can make mistakes. She said artists would get their "true independence" only when they "will be judged merely on their ability to perform".

212.title: Mangaluru corporation removes Savarkar banner over SDPI complaints
212.article_body: In Mangaluru, a flex banner naming the Surathkal Junction after Vinayak Damodar Savarkar was removed after workers of the Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI) objected against it and notified the police. Mangaluru City Corporation approved the proposal to name the circle after Savarkar. However, since the government has not granted permission, the banner was removed over the complaints.

213.title: John Abraham announces new film ’Tariq’; to release on Aug 15, 2023
213.article_body: On the 76th Independence Day, John Abraham announced his next film, 'Tariq'. The film will release on the Independence Day next year. Sharing the news, John wrote, "Time to celebrate the freedom to tell good stories." The film marks his third collaboration with Bake My Cake Films after 'Batla House' and 'Tehran'.

214.title: 61 empty ZP flats to be converted to working women's hostel in Pune
214.article_body: The Zilla Parishad (ZP) along with the women and children development department is planning to open a working women's hostel in 61 vacant flats of ZP buildings. The hostel will be for female students who are pursuing higher education and working women. The flats will undergo proper renovation, before being turned into a hostel, said Ayush Prasad, CEO at ZP.

215.title: Curfew in Karnataka's Shivamogga after protest over Savarkar's poster on I-Day
215.article_body: Prohibitory orders under CrPC Section 144 were imposed in parts of Shivamogga in Karnataka after Hindu activists protested against attempts to remove a poster of Hindutva ideologue Veer Savarkar on Independence Day. The incident was reported in the Ameer Ahmad circle in the city. The attempt to remove the poster was allegedly made by a group of Tipu Sultan followers.

216.title: Unity Software rejects gaming software firm AppLovin's $17.54 bn takeover offer
216.article_body: Video game software maker Unity on Monday rejected AppLovin Corp's $17.54 billion takeover offer and said it would go ahead with its deal to purchase mobile app monetisation software firm ironSource. The offer wasn't in the shareholders' best interest, Unity said. "The board continues to believe that the ironSource transaction is compelling," said Unity CEO John Riccitiello.

217.title: I bow down to RSS' ideals and patriotism, proud of it: K'taka CM
217.article_body: Responding to Congress' claim that he has become a slave of RSS, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday said that he's proud of RSS' ideals and bowed his head to its patriotism. "I'm committed to building the country on those ideals and principles and I'm proud of it," he said. Karnataka CM is RSS' slave, Congress leader Siddaramaiah had said.

218.title: Block website selling 'first copy' of Nike, LV shoes on discount: HC
218.article_body: The Delhi HC has ordered the blocking of a website, which was accused of selling 'first copy' of popular footwear brands like New Balance, Adidas, Louis Vuitton and Nike at highly discounted prices. Justice Navin Chawla, in an order, also sought details and KYC documents of three mobile numbers through which the website 'www.myshoeshop.in' was allegedly offering the products.

219.title: 3 people, including Army personnel, beaten up by 4 bouncers outside Gurugram nightclub
219.article_body: Three people, including an Army personnel, were beaten up by four bouncers outside a nightclub in Gurugram. As per the police, they had asked a bouncer to play music at the club after which the fight occurred.  A case under several sections of the IPC has been filed against the accused at the Gurugram Sector 29 Police Station.

220.title: Chief of Hyd's Rachakonda Police gets President's Police Medal
220.article_body: The Commissioner of Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police, Mahesh Bhagwat, has been awarded the 'President's Police Medal for Distinguished Service' by the Union Home Ministry. Bhagwat, a 1995-batch IPS officer of the Telangana cadre, has been serving as Rachakonda Police chief since 2016. In 2004, Bhagwat had been awarded the 'President's Police Medal for Gallantry'.

221.title: PM Modi doing politics through I-Day speech: Cong on nepotism remark
221.article_body: Congress leader Kumari Selja on Monday took a jibe at PM Narendra Modi over his "nepotism" remark by saying that PM was doing politics instead of focusing on issues concerning common people. "Unemployment is hitting people hard and the government is tight-lipped about it instead of speaking about nepotism," said Congress leader Ambika Soni.

222.title: 40-yr-old property dealer shot dead while riding his bike in Delhi
222.article_body: A 40-year-old property dealer was shot dead by unknown two-wheeler-borne miscreants on Sunday in southeast Delhi’s Jamia Nagar, police said. The victim, identified as Mohammad Waseef Sattar Ghazi, was reportedly riding his bike when some unknown persons fired at him. "The doctors of the hospital declared him dead. Police immediately reached the hospital and initiated an enquiry," an official said.

223.title: Andhra student's mother scolds him for low attendance; he dies by suicide
223.article_body: A 16-year-old student in Andhra Pradesh's Vuyyuru town allegedly died by suicide after being disturbed over being scolded by his mother for bunking classes. The victim's mother, who works as a teacher in a private school, had scolded him after noticing that his class attendance was poor. Based on the mother's complaint, police have registered a case of suspicious death.

224.title: It's tough: Busta on comparison between 1st Masters 1000 title, Olympic bronze
224.article_body: On being asked if winning his first ATP Masters 1000 title in Montreal on Sunday was a bigger achievement than his Olympic bronze medal, world number 14 Pablo Carreño Busta said it's tough to compare. "Beating Novak Djokovic to win the bronze...was probably the most exciting moment of my career for sure...but I'm enjoying also both of them," he added.

225.title: Many thought India will be ruined if British left, but it thrived: PM
225.article_body: Many during the last stages of the freedom struggle said India will be "ruined" and go into the "dark age" if the British left, but the country developed, PM Narendra Modi said on Monday. The people proved India has immense capacity to survive all odds even as "hundreds of years of slavery" had inflicted "deep wounds" on it, he added.

226.title: Several people attend flower show themed on Puneeth Rajkumar in B'luru
226.article_body: A huge crowd of fans of late actor Puneeth Rajkumar visited Lal Bagh to pay their tributes to him on the last day of the flower show. Over 1.2 lakh people visited the flower show in the last week. The Bengaluru Traffic Police issued a traffic advisory to the people who are visiting the park on Independence Day.

227.title: Delhi airport launches DigiYatra app for faster e-boarding
227.article_body: The Delhi International Airport Limited on Monday announced the soft launch of the 'DigiYatra' application, which passengers can now use for faster e-boarding through the airport. The 'DigiYatra' is a Biometric Enabled Seamless Travel experience (BEST) based on Facial Recognition Technology. The passengers' faces would act as their documents, like ID proof, vaccine proof and a boarding pass.

228.title: Bruno Coutinho and IM Vijayan worthier of AIFF Prez post: Bhaichung
228.article_body: Former India captain Bhaichung Bhutia has said he feels ex-players Bruno Coutinho and IM Vijayan are far more worthy than himself of being the next AIFF President. Bhaichung said he wishes to wait for the final electoral list before commenting on the people vying for the post. He added that there have been informal discussions about him contesting as well.

229.title: Couple, their 3 children die while sleeping as wall collapses in Chhattisgarh
229.article_body: A couple and their three children were killed as a wall in their house collapsed in Chhattisgarh's Kanker district, officials said. The victims were asleep in their mudhouse when the incident took place. Officials added that the area was cut off from the road due to an overflowing rivulet but despite that an administrative team managed to reach there.

230.title: Man arrested in Manesar for murdering friend over business rivalry
230.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested in Haryana's Manesar for allegedly murdering his friend over a business rivalry. The accused, Manoj, used to work with the deceased, Pankaj (27), in the construction business before they parted their ways, police said. Notably, Pankaj was allegedly hit multiple times on his head with a stone and his body was found in Kasan village.

231.title: Police constable injured in Srinagar encounter succumbs to injuries
231.article_body: A police constable who was injured during an encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar on Sunday succumbed to the injuries on Independence Day. The martyr has been identified as Constable Sarfaraz Ahmad, a resident of Batote area of Ramban district. Kashmir Zone Police said, "We pay rich tributes to the martyr for his supreme sacrifice made in line of duty."

232.title: Occultist accuses female helper of theft; owners strip, beat her in Delhi
232.article_body: A family in Delhi stripped their 43-year-old domestic help and assaulted her on suspicion of stealing from them after performing an occult ceremony. An occultist accused the victim of stealing from the family after a series of rituals, following which she was stripped naked, held captive in a room for almost 24 hours and assaulted, reports said.

233.title: Will provide aid to N Korea in exchange for denuclearisation: S Korea
233.article_body: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol on Monday offered economic aid to North Korea on condition that the latter abandons its nuclear weapons programme. "We'll implement a...[scheme] to provide food...transmission and distribution of electrical power and carry out projects to modernise ports...to facilitate trade," Yoon said. He made these remarks during a ceremony marking Korean Liberation Day.

234.title: UK becomes 1st country to approve booster vaccine that targets two COVID-19 variants
234.article_body: The UK has become the first country to approve a COVID-19 booster vaccine that targets two variants of the virus. The adapted COVID-19 vaccine made by Moderna targets the original virus from 2020 and the Omicron variant. The vaccine is authorised for use in people who are aged 18 or over.

235.title: Even 5 to 7-year-old children tell parents they don't want to play with foreign toys: PM
235.article_body: Talking about 'Atmanirbhar Bharat' during his Independence Day speech, PM Narendra Modi said, "I have heard from countless families that 5 to 7-year-old children tell their parents that they do not want to play with foreign toys." He added, "When a 5-year-old child makes such a resolution, it reflects the spirit of self-reliant India in him."

236.title: India-Bangladesh border force exchange sweets
236.article_body: On the occasion of India's 76th Independence Day, the Border Security Force (BSF) and Border Guards Bangladesh (BGB) shared sweets and greetings at the Indo-Bangladesh border in Fulbari, West Bengal. The border guarding forces of both the countries met in July and discussed reducing cross-border crimes and taking necessary steps to maintain peace and tranquillity along the border.

237.title: I'm trying to use pressure in my favour: Alcaraz ahead of Cincinnati Open
237.article_body: Ahead of his second round match at Cincinnati Open, world number four Carlos Alcaraz said he's learning to handle the pressure to be one of the favourites to win the tournament. "The kind of player I am means I am trying to use the pressure in my favour," he added. The 19-year-old lost in second round in Montreal last week.

238.title: We've to become self-reliant in energy sector: PM during I-Day speech
238.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, during his Independence Day address on Monday, said India has to become self-reliant in the energy sector. "How long will we be dependent on others in the field of energy? We should be self-reliant in the fields of solar energy, wind energy and various other renewable energy sources like Mission Hydrogen [and] biofuel," he added.

239.title: Take a pledge to make J&K corruption free: J&K L-G Sinha
239.article_body: J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha urged people to take an oath of making the Union Territory free of corruption and illegal drugs. He also declared that the valley will observe August 5 as "Freedom from Corruption" Day every year. “Let’s take a pledge to make J&K free of corruption and illegal drugs,” said Sinha.

240.title: 48-yr-old tea seller stores, sells Chinese manjha in Delhi, arrested
240.article_body: A 48-year-old shopkeeper was arrested for allegedly storing and selling the illegal 'Chinese manjha' in Delhi's Nihal Vihar area, police said on Monday. A total of 170 bundles of Chinese Manjha were recovered from the accused's shop, DCP (outer) Sameer Sharma said. The accused revealed that he was selling the illegal item to earn money, police said.

241.title: 1,108 new cases of COVID-19 logged in Bengaluru on Sunday
241.article_body: Bengaluru reported 1,108 fresh cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 6.58% on Sunday, as per data shared by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike's (BBMP) Chief Commissioner. No new deaths due to the infection were recorded. According to the data, 610 people recovered from the infection. The fresh cases and the recoveries took Bengaluru's active case count to 7,279.

242.title: Pune district to see rainfall till Aug 16, IMD sounds orange alert
242.article_body: With the Southwest monsoon currently active over Maharashtra and central India, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said that Pune district will receive moderate to heavy showers till August 16. The weather agency added that the district will remain on orange alert till then. The IMD also placed Raigad, Ratnagiri and Satara districts on orange alert.

243.title: 18-yr-old Gauff becomes second-youngest doubles world no. 1 with Toronto title
243.article_body: US' 18-year-old Coco Gauff has become world number one in women's doubles after winning the doubles title with fellow American Jessie Pegula at National Bank Open in Toronto. Third seeds beat unseeded pair of Ellen Perez and Nicole Melichar-Martinez 6-4, 6-7(5-7), [10-5] in Sunday's final. Gauff is the second-youngest player in history, behind Martina Hingis, to become doubles number one.

244.title: Want to build a nation where women are safe: West Bengal CM
244.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Monday expressed her desire to build a nation where no one goes hungry and where women feel safe. "I want to build a nation where no one goes hungry, where no woman feels unsafe, where every child sees the light of education, where all are treated equally," she tweeted.

245.title: 'NTR31' to go on floors by April 2023, director Prashanth Neel confirms
245.article_body: Director Prashanth Neel has confirmed that his upcoming film with Jr NTR, tentatively titled 'NTR31', will go on the floors by April 2023. The 'KGF 2' director, who called himself a fan of NTR, said he had met the actor 10-15 times to "understand him a little more". However, he refused to share any other details about the film.

246.title: Prabhas' 'Salaar' to release on Sept 28, 2023; will compete with Hrithik's 'Fighter'
246.article_body: The makers of 'Salaar' have announced the release date of the Prabhas starrer. The Prashanth Neel directorial will release on September 28, 2023. The film will be competing at the box office with Hrithik Roshan and Deepika Padukone's 'Fighter', which is set to release on the same date. 'Fighter', directed by Siddharth Anand, marks Hrithik and Deepika's first film together.

247.title: Feel protective about you as much as my twins: Johar on Ayan's b'day
247.article_body: Director Karan Johar on Monday penned a birthday note for Ayan Mukerji in which he praised the director's hard work and commitment to his dream project, 'Brahmastra'. Johar said he feels protective of Ayan just like he does for his twins, Yash and Roohi. He said while no one can predict Brahmastra's box-office journey, Ayan is already a winner.

248.title: Attempts were made to forget Ambedkar, Lal Bahadur Shastri: K'taka CM
248.article_body: Amid controversy over excluding first PM Jawaharlal Nehru in the Karnataka government's newspaper advertisement on freedom fighters, CM Basavaraj Bommai said that attempts have been made to forget icons BR Ambedkar and Lal Bahadur Shastri. "If any Prime Minister had thought about making known the contributions of various PMs to the country, it is Narendra Modi," Bommai said.

249.title: UP CM Yogi Adityanath hoists national flag in Lucknow
249.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath hoisted the Tricolour in Lucknow on the occasion of the 76th Independence Day and appreciated PM Modi's call for 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' programme. "PM Modi has made the Amrit Mahotsav programme of independence a national festival by connecting it with the common man...Today’s occasion is extremely important for all of us," said the CM.

250.title: TN govt to use AI surveillance to prevent elephant deaths due to train accidents
250.article_body: Tamil Nadu's forest department is planning to set up an artificial intelligence (AI) system to prevent elephant deaths due to train-related incidents on tracks between Madukkarai and Walayar in Coimbatore. The 150-metre area around the tracks will be divided into red, orange and yellow zones. Concerned authorities will be automatically alerted if an elephant enters any of the zones.

251.title: Disgusting, fans need to show respect: Kyrgios on fans calling Medvedev 'loser'
251.article_body: Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios has criticised fans after a video emerged on social media which shows a group of fans chanting "loser" towards world number one Daniil Medvedev. "Disgusting behaviour. This is the best we have in the sport, fans need to show some respect," tweeted Kyrgios. The incident happened after Medvedev lost to Kyrgios at the Canadian Open.

252.title: Centre begins process to auction additional 5,500 MHz of 5G spectrum
252.article_body: Department of Telecommunications (DoT) has started the process to auction off an additional 5,500 MHz of 5G spectrum after recently completing the sale of ₹1.5 lakh crore worth of airwaves. DoT has formed an internal committee to formulate a plan to include 37.0-42.5 GHz as international mobile telecommunications (IMT) bands. IMT is useful in offering 5G fixed wireless access services.

253.title: Zoom installer's macOS version can give attackers root access: Security expert
253.article_body: macOS version of Zoom installer can be used by attackers to gain root access to Mac, according to security specialist Patrick Wardle. Zoom's updater function installs update packages after checking if it has been cryptographically signed by Zoom. According to Wardle, attackers can substitute the update package with any malware program by keeping its name same as Zoom's signing certificate.

254.title: Tricolour hoisted at Bengaluru's Idgah Maidan for 1st time
254.article_body: On occasion of Independence Day, the Indian flag was hoisted at the Idgah Maidan in Bengaluru by revenue department officials on Monday morning amid tight security. This is the first time that the Indian flag was hoisted at the site. The flag hoisting was followed by the singing of the national anthem and the state anthem, reports said.

255.title: It's stupid to ignore 'Bazball': Sam Billings on Elgar's 'it has no longevity' comment
255.article_body: Responding to SA Test captain Dean Elgar's comment that England's 'Bazball' approach in Test cricket has no "longevity", England wicketkeeper-batter Sam Billings said, "You'd be pretty stupid to ignore that if I'm honest." Billings also referred to England Lions' win in the four-day practice match against South Africa and said it was a "wake-up call" for the Dean Elgar-led side.

256.title: French Prez Emmanuel Macron tweets in Hindi to wish Indians on Independence Day
256.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron on Monday tweeted in Hindi to wish Indians on 75 years of Independence. He wrote, "Dear friend Narendra Modi, dear people of India, congratulations on your Independence Day!" Macron added, "As you proudly celebrate India's stunning achievements in the past 75 years, you can count on France to always stand by your side."

257.title: Artistes make human image of India's map at Red Fort, PM Modi takes a walk; video viral
257.article_body: A video has gone viral showing young artistes forming a human image of the map of India at Red Fort during the Independence Day celebrations. In the video, PM Narendra Modi can be seen taking a walk and meeting the children and acknowledging their efforts. Another video showed PM Modi asking artistes from Punjab to do 'bhangra'.

258.title: Facebook missed Brazil polls-related misinformation in ads: Report
258.article_body: According to a report by London-based non-profit firm Global Witness, Facebook failed to detect election-related misinformation in ads ahead of the 2022 election in Brazil. The ads, which were approved by Facebook but never released, contained wrong election date and incorrect voting methods. In a statement, Meta said it has prepared extensively and launched tools to promote reliable information.

259.title: India rightfully enjoys high prestige globally: Putin on 76th I-Day
259.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday congratulated India on the occasion of its 76th Independence Day, stating that India "rightfully enjoys high prestige on the world stage". "India’s achievements in the economic, social and other fields are widely acknowledged...[India] plays an important role in resolving topical issues on the international agenda," Putin said in a message.

260.title: Congratulations to Indian people on 75 yrs of Independence: UK PM
260.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson tweeted in both Hindi and English as he congratulated Indian people on 75 years of Independence on Monday. He said that during his visit to Gujarat and New Delhi, he'd seen the "thriving Living Bridge" between UK and India. "I look forward to seeing these bonds go from strength to strength in...next 75 years," he added.

261.title: Central government is hurting federal values: Telangana CM KCR
261.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao said that the present central government is hurting the federal values. "It is indulging in conspiracies that weaken the states financially as if cutting the branch on which one is seated," Rao added. The Union government which talks about the ideals of cooperative federalism is, in reality, indulging in the centralisation of powers, Rao added.

262.title: Philippines looks to buy US helicopters after scrapping Russia deal
262.article_body: The Philippines is in talks with the US to buy Chinook helicopters after scrapping a $227.35 million deal with Russia for 16 Mi-17 military helicopters, Manila's ambassador said. The ambassador said the decision has been taken to avoid sanctions from the west. The US is willing to strike a deal with the Philippines of the same amount including maintenance.

263.title: Bharat Biotech completes phase 3 trial of intranasal COVID vaccine
263.article_body: Bharat Biotech on Monday said it has completed clinical development for phase 3 trials and booster doses for the BBV154 (Covaxin) intranasal COVID-19 vaccine. Bharat Biotech International Limited announced that BBV154 has proven to be safe, well-tolerated and immunogenic in subjects in controlled clinical trials. It has been specifically formulated to allow intranasal delivery.

264.title: DMK's Dravidian model embodies Mahatma's ideals: TN CM on I-Day
264.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin in his Independence Day address at Fort St George in Chennai earlier today said that the DMK regime's Dravidian model embodies Mahatma Gandhi's ideals of secularism and brotherhood. "Mahatma Gandhi epitomised all lofty humanitarian principles...and he is among the great national symbols that should be reminded often to people," Stalin said after unfurling the tricolour.

265.title: Man falls to death from terrace while raising flag in Bengaluru
265.article_body: A 33-year-old software engineer died on Sunday after falling from a second-floor terrace while trying to raise the national flag in Bengaluru's Hennur area, as per media reports. The man, identified as Vishwas Kumar, reportedly climbed the terrace wall to raise the flag at his home but slipped from there. Kumar is survived by his wife and a two-year-old daughter.

266.title: India hands over Dornier surveillance aircraft to Sri Lanka Navy
266.article_body: Indian High Commissioner in Colombo Gopal Baglay along with Vice Chief of Indian Navy Vice Admiral SN Ghormade handed over a Dornier maritime surveillance aircraft to the Sri Lanka Navy in Katunayake on Monday. This comes as India celebrates its 76th Independence Day. "Security of India and Sri Lanka is enhanced by mutual understanding, mutual trust and cooperation," Baglay said.

267.title: Morrison took on secret ministerial roles during COVID: Australian PM
267.article_body: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese sought legal advice after reports emerged that his predecessor Scott Morrison was secretly appointed to key ministerial roles, duplicating some portfolios during the pandemic. The Governor-General's office told Reuters that the appointments were valid under the constitution. However, Albanese accused Morrison of centralising power.

268.title: Freedom doesn't come without price: Urvashi Rautela on Independence Day
268.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela, speaking on the occasion of Independence Day, has said, "A big salute to all the soldiers who sacrificed their lives for our independence!" The actress further said that people should not let anything divide the idea of India. "Freedom does not come without a price, and neither did ours," she added.

269.title: Trial for drone-based healthcare services launched in Arunachal
269.article_body: A trial to use drones to provide healthcare services to tribal and rural communities in an Arunachal Pradesh town was launched on Monday. According to a press release, the healthcare drone pilots are a result of the state's partnership with the World Economic Forum's 'Medicine from the Sky' (MFTS) initiative. The drone network will serve the people of East Kameng.

270.title: 6 ancient wells restored at Hyderabad's Qutub Shahi Tombs
270.article_body: The Aga Khan Trust for Culture restored six historical wells situated at Golconda's Qutub Shahi Tombs compound to its past glory, Special Chief Secretary of Urban Administration Arvind Kumar said. The wells were in an extremely dilapidated condition and had turned almost into water puddle. After restoration, there is a total of 19.3 million litres of water in these wells.

271.title: Owaisi brothers hoist national flag in Hyderabad
271.article_body: AIMIM leaders Asaduddin Owaisi and Akbaruddin Owaisi hoisted the national flag in Hyderabad on the occasion of country's 76th Independence Day. The Tricolour was hoisted at Madina Circle near Charminar. "Our ancestors fought against British but they also fought for an India that was free from hunger, exploitation and tyranny. We must take their struggle forward," the Hyderabad MP said.

272.title: Iran reacts to attack on Rushdie, says he 'crossed red lines of 1.5 billion Muslims'
272.article_body: Iran's foreign ministry on Monday said no one has the right to level accusations against Iran over the attack on Salman Rushdie. "We do not consider anyone other than himself and his supporters worthy of...reproach and condemnation," Iran said. Rushdie "exposed himself to popular outrage by insulting Islamic sanctities and crossing the red lines of 1.5 billion Muslims," Iran added.

273.title: Traffic to stop in Hyd for mass singing of national anthem on Aug 16
273.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police on Sunday announced that traffic will come to a halt at all signalised and manned traffic junctions across the city for the mass singing of national anthem on August 16. All traffic signals will turn red at 11:30 am on Tuesday, police said. Police further urged commuters to stand and sing the national anthem at the junctions.

274.title: Man detained after Mukesh Ambani and his family receive death threats: Police
274.article_body: A suspect has been detained in Dahisar for issuing death threats to Reliance Industries' Chairman Mukesh Ambani and his family, Mumbai Police said. The man, who was identified as Afzal, allegedly made several threat calls on the display number of the Reliance Foundation Hospital on Monday morning. A case was registered after the hospital filed a complaint about the calls.

275.title: Haryana govt forms Municipal Council of Pataudi-Mandi
275.article_body: The municipalities of Pataudi and Haileymandi in Haryana have been merged and will now be operational as the Municipal Council of Pataudi-Mandi. Apart from having 10 adjoining villages, including Nerhera, Janola, Mirzapur and Mubarkpur, the newly-formed council is likely to have 32-35 wards. Notably, Haileymandi was named after an English governor named Malcolm Hailey.

276.title: Man claiming to be from Syria cheats Mumbai woman of ₹15 lakh
276.article_body: A 24-year-old technician from Mumbai lost ₹15 lakh in a 'customs clearance' fraud for claiming gifts sent by a man who claimed to be from Syria, police said on Sunday. The accused contacted the woman on Instagram and told her he would send his savings to her, for which she would need to pay customs charges, a police official said.

277.title: PM Modi let nation down by not discussing unfulfilled promises: Pawan Khera
277.article_body: Congress’ Pawan Khera said PM Narendra Modi has let the country down by not discussing the promises made by him in the last eight years and by not giving an account of his tenure. Khera's statement came following PM's Independence Day address. "His words sound tiring...his own words on promises made are troubling him now," Khera added.

278.title: Youth from tier-2, tier-3 cities behind success of startups: PM
278.article_body: During his ninth successive Independence Day speech, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that the success of digital and startup developments has been made possible by the youth of India's tier-2 and tier-3 cities. PM Modi mentioned that the country is moving towards 5G era. He also called India an aspirational society which is the biggest asset for any nation.

279.title: Man slits 22-yr-old pregnant girlfriend's throat over dispute in Thane
279.article_body: A 23-year-old man was arrested for allegedly slitting the throat of his 22-year-old pregnant girlfriend in Thane. During the investigation, it was found that the two had some issues arising from their relationship, said API Krupali Borse of the Mumbra police station. The accused wanted to get rid of the victim and killed her by slitting her throat, Borse said.

280.title: Israeli forces kill Palestinian man who tried to stab officers
280.article_body: Israeli police have said that security forces shot dead a Palestinian man who tried to stab officers during a raid in the occupied West Bank on Monday. The officers were conducting a raid at a house, police added. The deceased man's father claimed that his son wasn't armed and that the Israeli officers "immediately began shooting" on entering the house.

281.title: Stop reckless driving, illegal parking: Pune Traffic Police to PMPML
281.article_body: The Pune Traffic Police have written to the Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) to instruct their drivers to stop reckless driving at the Katraj chowk, adding that the drivers shouldn't illegally park their vehicles. "Action should be taken involved in rash driving. At Katraj stand, the drivers do not wait for passengers to board the bus," a commuter said.

282.title: US man drives vehicle through crowd leaving 1 dead, later kills mother
282.article_body: A 24-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly drove a vehicle through a crowd at a fundraiser event in Columbia County in US' Pennsylvania, then went home and killed his mother, police said. One person was killed and 17 others were injured in the incident at the fundraiser event, police added. The fundraiser was for victims of a house fire.

283.title: Stoinis accuses Pak bowler Hasnain of chucking, sparks controversy after video goes viral
283.article_body: Southern Brave's Australian all-rounder Marcus Stoinis accused Oval Invincibles' Pakistani pacer Muhammad Hasnain of chucking after the latter dismissed him. A video went viral showing Stoinis implying the 22-year-old's bowling action was illegal by miming a chucking motion. "Downright disgusting," a user tweeted. "How about sticking to playing...and letting officials do their job," wrote another.

284.title: Happy Independence Day to my fellow Indians all over the world: Preity
284.article_body: Actress Preity Zinta took to Instagram and wished her fans on the occasion of Independence Day. Preity shared pictures of herself and her twin babies with the national flag. Along with the pictures, she wrote, "Happy Independence Day to my fellow Indians all over the world from the three of us." Preity welcomed the twins in November 2021 through surrogacy.

285.title: Sonali Bendre celebrates Independence Day in Atlanta, shares pics
285.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre took to Instagram and shared pictures of her celebrations of India's Independence Day in Atlanta, United States. Along with the pictures, Sonali wrote, "Took a little bit of home to Atlanta." In the pictures, the actress can be seen waving the Indian national flag with several other Indians. Sonali recently featured in the OTT series 'Broken News'.

286.title: Indian fans love cricket: Mandhana on 'Women's IPL is coming' question
286.article_body: India Women batter Smriti Mandhana, who's currently playing in The Hundred women's tournament, was asked, "With the Women's IPL coming next year, can we expect the same kind of enthusiasm back in India as well?" Mandhana replied, "Indian fans love cricket and they turn up to support us regardless of whether it is a one-day or T20."

287.title: Not fair if we play 6 Tests in a year and India, Aus, Eng play 15: Anrich Nortje
287.article_body: South Africa pacer Anrich Nortje has said it's not fair that India, England and Australia are playing more Tests than them. "If we play six in a year and [they] play 15 in a year, I don't see that being fair. Our guys are not going to be as well-known...if we play 18 games in three years," he stated.

288.title: Gangster with ₹50,000 bounty arrested after shootout in Delhi
288.article_body: A 48-year-old gangster was arrested on Sunday following a brief shootout in southwest Delhi's Ghitorni village, officials said. The gangster, identified as Parveen Yadav, had a bounty of ₹50,000 over a case of shootout-cum-murder of a law student in Rohini in 2021, police said. Yadav was wanted in nearly 20 crime cases, including cases of extortion and assault, police added.

289.title: CM Bhagwant Mann announces setting up of 75 Aam Aadmi clinics in Punjab
289.article_body: On occasion of Independence Day, Punjab chief minister Bhagwant Mann has announced the setting up of 75 Aam Aadmi clinics in the state. The Chief Minister also praised youths from the state serving in Indian Army and said, "Every village of Punjab has...a memorial of martyrs who had fought for independence...Punjabi youths serving the Indian army are protecting the borders."

290.title: Pune woman completes 430-km-long 'Freedom Run' from Leh to Manali
290.article_body: Pune resident Preeti Maske has completed a 430-km-long 'Freedom Run' from Leh to Manali in a little over 118 hours, Border Roads Organisation (BRO) said in a tweet on Monday. "Daunting was the challenge, determined was Preeti," BRO's tweet further said. Maske had earlier set a Guinness World Record in June by cycling alone from Leh to Manali.

291.title: I-Day celebrations affect traffic movement on several roads in Delhi
291.article_body: The Independence Day celebrations led to vehicular traffic on several roads in Delhi on Monday. All Delhi borders have been closed due to security reasons, following which heavy traffic was reported on the DND flyover, Barapullah, Tikri border, Jharoda and Apsara Road. An additional police force was deployed in New Delhi, North Delhi and at the borders.

292.title: CR to add 10 additional AC local services in Mumbai division
292.article_body: The Central Railway (CR) will soon be adding 10 more air-conditioned (AC) local trains in Mumbai division, CPRO of CR said. Currently, there are 56 AC local services, with the 10 additional, total number of services will be 66. "The AC local is gaining popularity and it's evident by the sale of daily tickets," a CR official said.

293.title: What is DigiYatra app, the contactless passenger processing system for airports?
293.article_body: The Delhi International Airport Limited launched a beta version of the DigiYatra app, a passenger processing system based on facial recognition technology, at Terminal 3. After users download the app, they can pass through the airport's various checkpoints with paperless and contactless processing while their facial features will establish their identities, linking them to their boarding passes.

294.title: Thousands laid down their lives so India breathes this day: Sreejesh on I-Day
294.article_body: Indian men's hockey team goalkeeper PR Sreejesh took to Twitter on the occasion of 76th Independence Day and wrote, "Thousands laid down their lives so that our country breathes this day. Never forget their sacrifice." Commonwealth Games 2022 para table tennis gold medallist Bhavina Patel tweeted, "May our Tiranga always fly the highest. Wishing everyone a Happy Independence Day."

295.title: Won't make a comment on these things: Rahul on PM's nepotism remark
295.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi reacted to the 'Parivaarvaad' remark made by PM Narendra Modi in his Independence Day speech on Monday. "I won't make a comment on these things. Happy Independence to everyone," he said. PM Modi had said that two big challenges we face today are corruption and 'Parivaarvaad' or nepotism.

296.title: Man hides gold worth ₹13 lakh in underwear, caught at Hyd airport
296.article_body: Customs officials seized four gold bars, weighing 258.29 grams valued at ₹13,63,771, from a passenger who arrived at the Hyderabad airport from Dammam on Sunday morning. The passenger was trying to smuggle the gold bars by concealing them in a customised brief. Another passenger was arrested for trying to smuggle 154 grams of gold.

297.title: Holland takes break from social media, says 'I find it overstimulating'
297.article_body: 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' actor Tom Holland took to Instagram to announce a break from social media platforms. "I find Instagram and Twitter to be overstimulating, to be overwhelming," Holland said in the video. "I get caught up and I spiral when I read things about me online and ultimately it's very detrimental to my mental state," he added.

298.title: Tricolour will fly high when every Indian has access to good healthcare: Kejriwal
298.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said education and health are key to becoming a rich country. "Tricolour will fly high only when every Indian has access to good healthcare," Kejriwal added. Furthermore, he said, "A poor man's child can dream of becoming lawyer, engineer in Delhi because of education revolution here."

299.title: My grandparents would tell me horrifying stories of partition: Asees
299.article_body: Singer Asees Kaur has said that she was "really lucky" that she was born in free India. "My grandparents would tell us horrifying tales of Partition. I know their stories, struggles and all the hardships that they have gone through," she further added. Asees revealed she began singing when she was a five-year-old and added she sang all patriotic songs.

300.title: Taliban declares national holiday to mark 1 yr since return to power
300.article_body: Taliban has declared a national holiday on Monday to mark the first anniversary of its return to power in Afghanistan. "We fulfilled...obligation of jihad and liberated our country," a fighter who'd stormed Kabul during Taliban's takeover said. Thousands of people had rushed to Kabul airport as they tried to escape from Afghanistan after the Taliban's takeover on August 15, 2021.

301.title: Dropping Nehru's image in govt ad deliberate: Karnataka BJP leader
301.article_body: Karnataka BJP General Secretary and MLC Ravikumar on Monday said dropping Jawaharlal Nehru's image from the government advertisement for the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign was a "deliberate" act. "[Mahatma] Gandhiji had said that Congress should be dissolved after independence. However, Nehru didn't dissolve Congress. Due to all these reasons, we have dropped his picture from the ad," Ravikumar said.

302.title: Faridabad Police arrest 3 men for cheating people online
302.article_body: Three men were arrested by Faridabad Police for allegedly cheating people online. The suspects, Akshay, Darshan Bhai, and Sagar, assured high returns to the victims on conducting online business from home, police said. Notably, police have found transactions worth ₹47 crore in their bank accounts and recovered ₹1.20 lakh cash, one mobile phone, and one ATM card from their possession.

303.title: China conducts more drills near Taiwan amid US lawmakers' visit
303.article_body: Chinese military said they carried out more military drills near Taiwan on Monday. The step comes at a time when a group of US lawmakers visited Taiwan and met President Tsai Ing-wen. The People's Liberation Army's Eastern Theatre Command said the exercises were a stern deterrent to the US and Taiwan who continue to play political tricks.

304.title: After breaking up with Shakira, Gerard Pique dating 23-year-old PR student: Reports
304.article_body: After breaking up with singer Shakira, Barcelona footballer Gerard Pique is dating a 23-year-old PR student named Clara Chia Marti, as per reports. “Gerard and Clara have been seeing each other for months. She is a student who also works for him in his office, organising events," a source said. Pique and Shakira had announced their break-up in June.

305.title: Martin Guptill breaks Rohit Sharma's world record for scoring most runs in T20I cricket
305.article_body: New Zealand opener Martin Guptill has broken Team India captain Rohit Sharma's world record for scoring most runs in T20I cricket. With his 15-run knock in the third T20I against West Indies, Guptill took his tally of runs in T20I cricket to 3,497, overtaking Rohit, who has scored 3,487 runs. Virat Kohli is third on the list, with 3,308 runs.

306.title: PayNearby launches 'zero investment plan' for rural women
306.article_body: Fintech startup PayNearby launched a 'zero investment plan' for women entrepreneurs across 20,000+ pin codes. To help rural women achieve financial independence, under this initiative, the firm will waive off opening fees for business account, which are otherwise charged at ₹1,000. Women partners, however, will be required to pay a bare minimum cost for the KYC completion.

307.title: PMC to construct 150 mobile immersion tanks for Ganesh Chaturthi
307.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has commenced preparations along with its Solid Waste Management Department to build 150 mobile immersion tanks for Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations this year. Along with these tanks, PMC will also construct over 130 fixed tanks for the idols' immersion across the city. The expenses for the fixed tanks have been approved, the civic body confirmed.

308.title: Rushdie's son releases statement, says his sense of humour remains intact after attack
308.article_body: Salman Rushdie's son Zafar has released his family's statement on his father's condition after the author was stabbed multiple times on Friday in New York. Zafar said his father remains in critical condition, adding, "Though his life-changing injuries are severe, his usual feisty and defiant sense of humour remains intact." Zafar thanked audience members who helped Rushdie after the attack.

309.title: President Droupadi Murmu pays tribute at National War Memorial in Delhi
309.article_body: On occasion of Independence Day, President Droupadi Murmu paid tribute at National War Memorial in Delhi on Monday. News agency ANI reported that Army chief, General Manoj Pande, Indian Navy chief, Admiral R Hari Kumar and Indian Air Force chief, Air Chief Marshal VR Chaudhari were also present. Pictures were shared on the official Twitter handle of President of India.

310.title: BJP will say we are distributing freebies: Tejashwi on Nitish's jobs announcement
310.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav reacted to CM Nitish Kumar's announcement of 10 lakh jobs and 10 lakh additional employment opportunities and said that BJP will now say that we are distributing freebies. "I was saying from the beginning that we, and not BJP, will fulfil the promise...It's an achievement that today discussions are being held on employment," he added.

311.title: Catastrophe: German minister on mass die-off of fish in Oder river
311.article_body: German Environment Minister Steffi Lemke on Sunday called the mass die-off of fish in Oder river, which runs through Germany and Poland, an "ecological disaster". Lemke was addressing a press conference along with her Polish counterpart Anna Moskwa. Moskwa said that Oder river samples will be tested for about 300 potential substances and will also be sent to foreign laboratories.

312.title: I didn't expect it could happen again: Nadal on chance to become world no. 1
312.article_body: World number three Rafael Nadal has said he didn't expect that he could again have the chance to become the world number one men's singles player. Nadal could become the top-ranked player if he wins the Cincinnati Open and Daniil Medvedev faces an early exit. "It means a lot to me to have [this] opportunity," added Nadal.

313.title: Maharashtra CM hoists Tricolour on 76th Independence Day
313.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde hoisted the Tricolour at the state secretariat on the country's 76th Independence Day. CM Shinde said that his government is committed to extend the reservation benefits to Other Backward Classes, Maratha and Dhangar communities. "We started working from day one and our priority is to work for the common man, farmers," he added.

314.title: Transparent selection without nepotism got India medals: PM Modi on CWG 2022
314.article_body: While addressing the nation on the occasion of 76th Independence Day, PM Narendra Modi stated that it is his constitutional duty to fight nepotism. Referring to the CWG 2022, he stated, "We saw in the recently concluded sports event we did well. It’s not that we didn’t have talent earlier...but transparent selection bereft of nepotism led to India scoring medals."

315.title: Will oppose misrepresentation of historical facts: Sonia Gandhi
315.article_body: While addressing the nation on the 76th Independence Day, Congress president Sonia Gandhi criticised the Centre and said the government is hell-bent on trivialising sacrifices of freedom fighters and their glorious achievements. “Congress will strongly oppose misrepresentation of historical facts for political gains and every attempt to put national leaders in the dock,” said Sonia.

316.title: Priyanka Gandhi, Rahul take part in Cong’s 'Azadi Gaurav Yatra' in Delhi
316.article_body: Congress leaders Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and Rahul Gandhi on Monday took part in party's 'Azadi Gaurav Yatra' in Delhi on Independence Day. Party leaders Anand Sharma and Ghulam Nabi Azad also took part in the Yatra. "We should remember our martyrs, citizens and leaders who sacrificed their lives for independence and due to whom we are independent today," Priyanka said.

317.title: PM's 'bhai-batijawad' comment was likely on his own party: Congress
317.article_body: Congress reacted to PM Narendra Modi's 'bhai-batijawad' comment during his Independence Day address and said that it is likely an internal issue of the BJP. "Only PM Modi can clarify whether his attack was on his own ministers or their sons...But the country expected him to submit a report card of the last eight years," Congress' Pawan Khera said.

318.title: Domino's India responds after pics of mops hanging above pizza dough go viral
318.article_body: Domino's India responded after purported pictures of cleaning mops and a toilet brush hanging above trays of pizza dough at its outlet in Bengaluru went viral on Twitter. Domino's said that it has zero tolerance for violations of hygiene and food safety standards. "The incident...will be thoroughly investigated and basis the findings, appropriate measures will be rolled out," it added.

319.title: Indian-origin astronaut shares pics of Hyderabad from space, Tricolour at space station
319.article_body: On the occasion of Independence Day, Indian-American astronaut Raja Chari shared pictures of the Tricolour at International Space Station and view of Hyderabad from space. "I'm reminded of Indian diaspora that I could see from [space station] where my immigrant father's home town of Hyderabad shines bright. [NASA] is just 1 place Indian-Americans make a difference every day," he tweeted.

320.title: Virat, Anushka join 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign, pose with Tricolour at Mumbai home
320.article_body: Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli wished the people on the occasion of India's 76th Independence Day and displayed the Tricolour at their residence in Mumbai, joining Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. "Celebrating 75 years of our Independence. Wishing all the Indians around the world a very Happy Independence Day. Jai Hind," Anushka wrote on Instagram.

321.title: Bihar CM announces 10 lakh jobs, 10 lakh additional employment opportunities on I-Day
321.article_body:
On the occasion of Independence Day, Bihar Chief Minister announced arrangement of 10 lakh jobs and 10 lakh additional employment opportunities in the state. Taking to Twitter, Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Tejashwi Yadav wrote, "Many thanks to respected Chief Minister Shri @NitishKumar
 ji for the historic announcement of arranging 10 lakh jobs and other 10 lakh [additional] jobs in Bihar."

322.title: 80 children die from measles amid outbreak in Zimbabwe: Report
322.article_body: Zimbabwe's health ministry has said that 80 children have died following a measles outbreak since April, which has now spread nationwide with a case fatality rate of 6.9%, according to a statement seen by Reuters. "[Church gatherings] which were attended by people from different provinces...with unknown vaccination status led to...spread of measles," the ministry's secretary said in a statement.

323.title: Man with knife can't silence man with pen: NY Guv on attack on Rushdie
323.article_body: New York State Governor Kathy Hochul has condemned the attack on author Salman Rushdie, saying, "A man with a knife can't silence a man with a pen." Hochul made the remark during an address at Chautauqua Institution, where the attack took place. "New York State will always stand up to protect freedom of expression [and] freedom of speech," she added.

324.title: I'll remember this for life: Raducanu on facing Serena Williams at Cincinnati Open
324.article_body: The reigning US Open champion Emma Raducanu has said she's excited to play against Serena Williams for the first time in their first-round match at the Cincinnati Open. "It'll be an incredible experience...I'll surely remember [it] the rest of my life," said the 19-year-old. Williams will be playing her last WTA tournament before her retirement at the US Open.

325.title: Mukesh Ambani and his family receive threat calls, Mumbai Police begin probe
325.article_body: A complaint has been filed by the Reliance Foundation Hospital about receiving calls posing threat to Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani and his family, ANI reported quoting Mumbai Police on Monday. As many as eight calls were received at the hospital, as per reports. Mumbai Police said that a case is being filed in this matter and investigation is underway.

326.title: Woman's 'You're a bomber' text to boyfriend leads to 6-hour delay in Mumbai flight
326.article_body: An IndiGo flight travelling from Mangaluru to Mumbai was delayed by six hours after a woman passenger alerted the cabin crew about a suspicious text message on a fellow traveller’s phone. The man was reportedly texting his girlfriend, who wrote to him 'You are a bomber'. The police later confirmed that it was a friendly chat between both of them.

327.title: Mukesh Ambani celebrates Independence Day with wife Nita, grandson Prithvi
327.article_body: A video showing Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani celebrating Independence Day with wife Nita Ambani and grandson Prithvi Ambani has surfaced online. The video shows AR Rahman's 'Maa Tujhe Salaam' playing in the background with several people holding the National Flags. His house Antilia was also lit up in Tricolour.

328.title: Mumbai banker wanting to get Fastag recharge loses ₹7 lakh in cyber-fraud
328.article_body: A 34-year-old Mumbai-based bank manager, who wanted to get her Fastag recharged, lost ₹7 lakh to cyber-fraudsters after calling a Fastag helpline number she found on internet. As per the complainant, the fraudsters took her vehicle details and sent a link to her. After clicking on the link, the victim logged into her bank's app and the money got deducted.

329.title: They call him 'Badshah of BSE', but he was a dreamer: Irani on Jhunjhunwala
329.article_body: Condoling the demise of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, Union Minister Smriti Irani tweeted, "They call him a billionaire investor, the badshah of BSE...but what he really was...is and always will be...is a dreamer." In another tweet, Irani wrote, "Bhaiyya always told me 'apan apne dam par jeeyenge' (we will live on our own terms)...And he lived on his own terms."

330.title: BSF, Pakistan Rangers exchange sweets at Int’l Border in J&K on India’s I-Day
330.article_body: On the occasion of India’s 76th Independence Day, sweets were exchanged between the Border Security Force (BSF) troops and Pakistan Rangers at the International Border in Jammu and Kashmir’s RS Pura. "BSF has always been on the forefront in creating a peaceful and congenial atmosphere on border while dominating the border effectively," BSF said.

331.title: Let's take vow not to forget history: Kamal Haasan on Independence Day
331.article_body: Taking to Twitter, Kamal Haasan wished his fans on the occasion of Independence Day. "If you forget history, you'll have to return to the...same old days says history. Let us take a vow not to forget history," Kamal wrote in Tamil. He urged people to recall freedom fighters and Indian armed forces that enabled them to celebrate Independence Day.

332.title: Assam govt to withdraw 1 lakh minor cases to reduce burden on lower judiciary: CM
332.article_body: Assam government will withdraw one lakh minor cases, including those for social media posts to help reduce the burden on lower judiciary, state Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said. The announcement came during Independence Day celebrations in Guwahati. He said that the government has decided that minor cases registered before midnight of August 14, 2021, will be withdrawn.

333.title: Indian Navy hoist Tricolour across 6 continents, 3 oceans & 6 time zones; video surfaces
333.article_body: As part of the celebrations on 75 years of Independence, the Indian Navy have deployed warships to every continent except Antarctica. The Indian Navy warships hoisted the Tricolour across six continents, three oceans and six different time zones. The warships were deployed in Perth, Singapore, Muscat, Mombasa, London, Rio de Janeiro and San Diego.

334.title: 'Laal...' gives message of maintaining mutual brotherhood: Punjab CM Mann
334.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann took to Twitter and praised Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "Today, I got a chance to watch 'Laal Singh Chaddha'...the movie gives a message of maintaining mutual brotherhood...not letting the seeds of hatred grow in tender hearts," he tweeted. Mann further congratulated Aamir and his team. Mann's tweet comes amid the boycott calls against the film.

335.title: B'luru buildings light up with tri-coloured lights on I-Day, pics surface
335.article_body: On the occasion of Independence Day, several buildings in Bengaluru lit up in tri-coloured lights. Bengaluru MP PC Mohan shared picture of illuminated Vidhan Soudha. Meanwhile, Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya shared video of NIMHANS Bengaluru "proudly lit with Tricolour glory". Pictures of Munireddypalya TV Tower and Sir M Visvesvaraya Baiyyappanahalli Railway terminal were also shared.

336.title: Bill Gates tweets on India's I-Day, praises PM Modi for prioritising healthcare
336.article_body:
The world’s fifth richest man and Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates tweeted wishes on India's 76th Independence Day. He tweeted, "As India celebrates its Independence Day, I congratulate 
Narendra Modi for prioritising healthcare and digital transformation while spearheading India's development. India's progress in these sectors is inspiring and we are fortunate to partner in this journey."

337.title: Were told not to go to police, teacher paid ₹1.5 lakh: Raj dalit boy's uncle
337.article_body: Uncle of nine-year-old dalit boy, who died after he was beaten up by his school teacher for drinking water from the pot, said that the Rajputs told the family to reach a compromise and not go to the police. "The teacher gave us ₹1.5 lakh...in two instalments and said...he was ready to pay another lakh for...Indra's treatment," the uncle said.

338.title: 300 firefighters battle forest fire in Spain; 1,500 evacuated
338.article_body: About 1,500 people were evacuated on Sunday due to a raging forest fire in Spain's Zaragoza province as 300 firefighters battled the blaze. The regional head said that the forest fire had spread rapidly due to high winds and that the situation was "critical". The blaze had spread over a 50 km area within 24 hours, a forest chief said.

339.title: PM Modi releases pics of Independence Day celebration at Red Fort today
339.article_body: PM Narendra Modi shared pictures of the Independence Day celebration held at the Red Fort on Monday. PM Modi addressed the nation from the monument after hoisting the Tricolour and listed five resolves for the citizens for the next 25 years. The resolves include developing India, removing every ounce of slavery, pride for our glorious heritage, unity and fulfilling duties.

340.title: Infosys is in stable position because of its founders: CEO Parekh
340.article_body: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh praised the company's founding members for building an "incredible organisation" and voiced confidence that the firm will continue to be stable. In an interview with PTI, Parekh said he believes that Infosys is "well-positioned" to leverage tech-led growth opportunities over the next several years. Infosys raised full-year revenue growth outlook to 14-16% for FY23.

341.title: Aug 5 to be celebrated as 'Freedom from Corruption' day every year in J&K: Sinha
341.article_body: J&K LG Manoj Sinha said the administration has decided that August 5 will be celebrated as "Freedom from Corruption" day every year. "Continuous drives against corruption will be done throughout the year," Sinha added. He took part in Independence Day celebrations in Srinagar on Monday. "In new J&K, ground of 21st century for realising dreams...of youth...being prepared," Sinha added.

342.title: CM Bommai participates in midnight flag hoisting event in Bengaluru
342.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai took part in midnight flag hoisting and cultural program organised as part of 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' to mark 75th anniversary of India's independence at Bengaluru's Malleswaram Barangay. "PM Narendra Modi's 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign received an amazing response. We saw record participation from people across different walks of life," he said at the event.

343.title: Video of Spurs manager Conte, Chelsea boss Tuchel's heated argument viral
343.article_body: A video of Tottenham Hotspur manager Antonio Conte and Chelsea manager Thomas Tuchel's heated argument after their sides played out a 2-2 draw has gone viral. When both managers came face to face after the match, they had to be separated by players. Conte and Tuchel had also confronted each other when Spurs had equalised the scoreline to 1-1.

344.title: Self-obsessed govt adamant to trivialise freedom fighters' sacrifices: Sonia Gandhi
344.article_body: On the occasion of Independence Day, Congress chief Sonia Gandhi said today's "self-obsessed government" is adamant about "trivialising" sacrifices of freedom fighters and achievements of the country. "Congress will oppose wrong statements made on historical facts for political benefits...every attempt to question...national leaders like Gandhi, Nehru, Patel and Azad on basis of lies," she added.

345.title: PM Modi uses paper notes not teleprompter for his 82-min I-Day speech
345.article_body: PM Narendra Modi used paper notes and not a teleprompter, in his address to the nation on the occasion of 76th Independence Day. His speech lasted about 82 minutes and this marked his ninth address from the Red Fort. Among other things, PM Modi laid out a development strategy for India for the next 25 years in his speech.

346.title: 50th anniversary of independence wasn't packaged like this: Himachal CM
346.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur praised the 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' initiative of his party to mark 75 years of India's independence and said, this is how Prime Minister Narendra Modi operates. Criticising the Congress government, he said, "The fiftieth year of independence had just passed us by like a routine (event). It wasn't packaged like this big event."
