347.title: India's achievements in combating COVID-19 better than developed countries: Prez
347.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu said India's achievements in combating COVID-19 pandemic have been better than those of many developed countries. "For this feat, we're grateful to our scientists, doctors...paramedics...staff associated with vaccination," she added. The government and policymakers deserve credit for "beating global trend and helping economy flourish" despite COVID-19 pandemic, she stated.

348.title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh hoists national flag in Delhi
348.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh hoisted the tricolour at his residence in Delhi. Singh tweeted, “Unfurled the National Flag at my residence on the 75th anniversary of India’s Independence.” Singh asserted on Saturday that the government has put in place a flawless security system to ensure that no anti-India element can cast an evil eye on the sovereignty of the country.

349.title: Kerala Congress criticises PM Modi over ‘Parivarvaad’ remark
349.article_body: Kerala Congress criticised PM Modi for his remark on nepotism during his Independence Day speech. The party said, "We need to free the country from sangh parivarvaad. There's a real need to raise awareness against these corrupt termites in power who eat and sell whatever we've built as a country in the last 75 years!"

350.title: PM Modi pays tribute to Mahatma Gandhi at Rajghat
350.article_body: PM Modi paid tribute to Mahatma Gandhi at Rajghat on the country’s 76th Independence Day. He also greeted people on the occasion. “Greetings on this very special Independence Day,” PM Modi said. The August 15 ceremony is significant this year as it marks the 75th anniversary of India's independence, with the government launching a host of exercises and programmes.

351.title: S Korean Prez calls for improved ties with Japan, peace with N Korea
351.article_body: South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol said South Korea must overcome historical disputes with Japan and achieve peace with North Korea to bolster stability. Yoon made the statement during a ceremony which marked Korean Liberation Day. The relations between South Korea and Japan strained over Korean accusations of wartime abuse like Japan forcing women to work in brothels for its military.

352.title: Necessary to add 'Jai Anusandhan' to 'Jai Jawan, Jai Kisan, Jai Vigyaan': PM
352.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said there is necessity to make addition to 'Jai Jawan, Jai Kisan, Jai Vigyaan' slogan. "We...remember Lal Bahadur Shastri ji's slogan of 'Jai Jawan, Jai Kisan'...Later, AB Vajpayee added 'Jai Vigyaan' to this slogan. Now, there is...necessity to add - 'Jai Anusandhan' (research & innovation). Jai Jawan, Jai Kisan, Jai Vigyaan aur Jai Anusandhan," he added.

353.title: BJP chief JP Nadda greets people on Independence Day
353.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda extended his wishes to all the countrymen on the country’s 76th Independence Day. He paid tributes to freedom fighters who sacrificed their lives. “Happy Independence Day to all. Tribute to the great revolutionaries and freedom fighters who dedicated their lives for the freedom of Mother Bharati. This country will always be indebted to you,” tweeted Nadda.

354.title: Taliban must allow girls to go to school: Former Afghan Prez Karzai
354.article_body: In an interview with DW News, former Afghanistan President Hamid Karzai said Taliban must allow girls to go to school and Afghan women will be educated to become engineers, doctors, journalists and parliamentarians. "There's no compromise, no way we will allow Afghan girls being denied education," Karzai added. Karzai called the manner of the US troop withdrawal from Afghanistan disgraceful.

355.title: Putin writes to Kim Jong-un, says Russia & North Korea will expand relations: Reports
355.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin wrote to North Korea's Kim Jong-un on liberation day of Korea and said the two countries will "expand the comprehensive and constructive bilateral relations with common efforts", North Korean state media reported. Putin said closer ties would be in both countries' interests and would help strengthen the security and stability of the Korean peninsula, it added.

356.title: Let us make India the strongest, most prosperous: Harbhajan, Hardik on I-Day
356.article_body: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya and former India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter to share their wishes on the occasion of Independence Day. Hardik shared pictures holding the National Flag and wrote, "To all my fellow Indians, happy Independence Day." Harbhajan said, "Let us make India the strongest and most prosperous with our collective efforts."

357.title: India is mother of democracy, has proved it has precious ability: PM on I-Day
357.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, during his Independence Day speech on Monday, said that India is the mother of democracy and has proved that it has a precious ability. "In this fight for Independence, struggle has continued in every corner of India...In the last 75 years, those who have died for the country...should be remembered and praised today," he added.

358.title: India sees 14,917 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate rises to 7.52%
358.article_body: India has reported 14,917 new COVID-19 cases and 32 deaths in the last 24 hours, including four reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's active caseload stood at 1,17,508, while the daily positivity rate rose to 7.52%. The COVID-19 death toll in the country reached 5,27,069.

359.title: Kartik to begin shooting for 'SatyaPrem...' in Gujarat next month: Report
359.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan will reportedly begin filming for his upcoming film 'SatyaPrem Ki Katha' in Gujarat from next month. As per the report, the shooting will take place in Ahmedabad and its outskirts. The film also features Kartik's 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' co-star Kiara Advani. 'SatyaPrem Ki Katha' will be directed by Sameer Vidwans.

360.title: Blast leaves 5 dead in Ecuador; govt blames organised crime
360.article_body: Five people were killed and at least 16 others were injured in an explosion that took place in Ecuador's port city of Guayaquil on Sunday, officials said. Following the incident, the country's government blamed the blast on organised crime, officials added. Ecuador's Interior Minister said that this is a "declaration of war" against the state by "organised crime mercenaries".

361.title: In pics: Monuments across India illuminated in Tricolour lights
361.article_body: Monuments and heritage buildings across India were illuminated in Tricolour lights on the eve of the Independence Day. The buildings in this collection include India Gate, Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus, Gateway of India, Humayun's Tomb, Ghanta Ghar in Srinagar, Safdarjung Tomb, Sardar Sarovar Dam, Karnataka Vidhana Soudha, West Bengal Raj Bhavan, Metcalfe Hall and Victoria Memorial.

362.title: SBI hikes lending rate by 0.2% across tenors from today, EMIs to go up
362.article_body: The State Bank of India (SBI) has hiked the marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by 20 basis points, or 0.2%, across all tenors, effective August 15. With the hike in rates, housing, vehicle and personal loans will become more expensive. Several banks raised their lending rates after the RBI increased repo rate by 50 bps earlier this month.

363.title: Salman Khan wishes fans on Independence Day, shares pic with national flag
363.article_body: Actor Salman Khan took to Instagram on the occasion of Independence Day and shared a picture of himself holding the Indian national flag. Along with the picture, he wrote, "Wishing everyone a very happy 75th Independence Day. Jai Hind." Actress Sara Ali Khan also wished her fans on Independence Day on Instagram Stories and shared a tricolour collage.

364.title: I'm just dreaming for more: Simona Halep after winning her 3rd Canadian Open
364.article_body: Ex-world number one Simona Halep defeated Brazil's Beatriz Haddad Maia in Toronto to win her third Canadian Open title. Simona, who won 6-3, 2-6, 6-3, will now be placed sixth in next week's world rankings. "When I started the year...I set the goal to be...[in the] top 10. And here I am...I'm just dreaming for more," said Halep.

365.title: 18% of almost 1 crore registered MSMEs are women-owned: Govt data
365.article_body: Women entrepreneurs own 18% of micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) registered in the country, according to government data. The Minister of State for MSMEs, Bhanu Pratap Singh Verma, shared the data in the Rajya Sabha. As of August 3, 2022, 17,96,408 MSMEs were owned by women out of the total 99,58,903 MSMEs registered on the Udyam portal.

366.title: Pic shows snake 'camouflaging' with dry sticks; IFS officer asks 'what do you see'
366.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan tweeted a picture of a snake camouflaging with dry sticks and leaves on what appeared to be a forest floor. "Camouflage level !! So what do you see? This snake is called as Mock Viper. Mildly venomous. See how good it is in camouflaging," the officer wrote with the picture.

367.title: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat hoists national flag at Nagpur headquarters
367.article_body: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat hoisted the national flag at the RSS headquarters in Nagpur, Maharashtra amid tight security. "Today is the day of pride and resolution. The country got freedom after a lot of struggle, it needs to be self-reliant," Bhagwat said while addressing the gathering. India will give message of peace to the world, he added.

368.title: Apple updated its policy to explicitly ban caste-based discrimination 2 years ago
368.article_body: Apple has confirmed that it updated its general employee conduct policy about two years ago to explicitly prohibit caste-based discrimination. The company added caste alongside existing categories such as race, religion, gender, age and ancestry. Apple reportedly updated its policy after Cisco was sued on behalf of a low-caste engineer who accused two higher-caste bosses of blocking his career.

369.title: We have to keep India first, this will pave way for a united India: PM Modi
369.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi in his Independence Day speech at the Red Fort said, "We have to keep India first, this will pave way for a united India." He also asked Indians to take the pledge to work towards the development of India, to erase all forms of colonial baggage and to display pride in the heritage of the country.

370.title: Length of tenure doesn't matter, your contribution matters: Justice Lalit
370.article_body: Justice UU Lalit said that length of tenure doesn't matter, it's about one's contribution. Hindustan Times quoted Justice Lalit as saying, "The length of the tenure doesn't matter to me. Every person gets a different tenure in the institution and I believe it's your contribution that matters." "Whatever you may do has to be at the institutional level," he stated.

371.title: May we continue to grow & become stronger: Shilpa on Independence Day
371.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty took to Instagram and shared a video on the occasion of Independence Day. Along with the video, she wrote, "Happy Independence Day. May we continue to grow and become stronger over the next 75 years to come." Shilpa, who recently featured in 'Nikamma', will next be seen in Rohit Shetty's directorial 'Indian Police Force'.

372.title: Didn't get help till 6 am, couldn't connect to police helpline: Mete's driver
372.article_body: Vinayak Mete's driver, Eknath Kadam, said they got delayed response after accident. "Accident took place at around 5 to 5:15 am...Till 6 am, we did not receive any kind of help except for a small tempo, driver of which stopped to help me. I was trying to call the police helpline number 100 but I could not connect," he said.

373.title: Taiwan thanks India, others for support amid tensions with China
373.article_body: Taiwan has expressed gratitude to India and other nations over their calls for exercising restrain and avoiding unilateral actions to change the status quo amid tensions with China. "Taiwan will continue to enhance its self-defence capabilities while maintaining close communication and coordination with the US, Japan and all other like-minded nations including India," it added.

374.title: boAt celebrates its ‘1 million Make In India milestone' of manufacturing
374.article_body: boAt celebrates the manufacturing of 1 million made-in-India units through its Rock'In India campaign. For this campaign, boAt collaborated with Mayur Jumani to bring out the music created using the symphony of factory sounds showcasing India's dedication to Make and Rock In India, it said, adding that it becomes the only brand in its category to achieve 1 million mark.

375.title: Corruption & nepotism are 2 big challenges we face today: PM Modi on Independence Day
375.article_body: PM Narendra Modi in his Independence Day speech said, "Two big challenges we face today are corruption and 'parivaarwaad' or nepotism." He said, "Corruption is hollowing the country like a termite, we've to fight it." He added, "We've to raise awareness against 'parivaarwaad' to realise the strength of our institutions, to take the country forward on the basis of merit."

376.title: In next 25 yrs, we'll build a tech hub better than Silicon Valley: Vedanta chief on I-Day
376.article_body: Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal took to Twitter on the occasion of India's 76th Independence Day. He wrote, "This is India's moment...From start-ups to sports, our youth have surpassed the world’s expectations. In the next 25 years, we'll build the world's leading technology hub, even better than Silicon Valley. With disruptive technology, we'll soon transform ourselves into an Atmanirbhar Bharat."

377.title: Youth in India is brimming with potential & highly motivated: Kartik Aaryan
377.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has said the current generation of India wants opportunities from the country. "The youth in India...is brimming with potential, equipped with an advanced skill set and above all hardworking to the core," he stated. "They're highly motivated, ambitious with a go-getter attitude," he added. Kartik said with the right opportunities, there's nothing youth in India can't do.

378.title: BEST's ₹1 travel plan extended till August 31 in Mumbai
378.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) announced that it will extend its 'freedom plan' for Mumbaikars till August 31. "Around one lakh Mumbaikars used ₹1 BEST freedom plan in the last 12 days," said a BEST official. The plan, which was launched on August 1, allows commuters to travel by BEST buses to any location by paying ₹1.

379.title: I feel Shubman is being groomed as opener for 2023 ODI World Cup:
379.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Deep Dasgupta has said KL Rahul should open India's innings in the three-match ODI series against Zimbabwe. "Rahul needs to get a lot of batting time...[But] I think it'll be a short-term arrangement as Shubman, I feel, is being groomed as opener for the ODI World Cup," he stated. Rahul hasn't played any competitive cricket since IPL 2022.

380.title: People of India want positive changes at quick pace: PM Modi
380.article_body: Addressing the nation on Independence Day on Monday, PM Narendra Modi said an aspirational society is an asset to any country. "We're proud that today in every corner of India aspirations are high," PM Modi added. "The people of India want positive changes...they want it at a quick pace. They also want to contribute towards it," he stated.

381.title: US Prez releases statement on I-Day, says, 'India & US are indispensable partners'
381.article_body: US President Joe Biden has released a statement extending wishes to India on Independence Day, saying, "The US joins the people of India to honor its democratic journey, guided by Mahatma Gandhi's enduring message of truth and non-violence." "India and the United States are indispensable partners...Our partnership is further strengthened by the deep bonds between our people," he added.

382.title: Man crashes car, fires shots in air then kills self near US Capitol
382.article_body: A 29-year-old man shot himself dead after crashing his car into a barricade and firing shots into the air near the US Capitol on Sunday, police said. Following the crash, the car became engulfed in flames as the man got out, the police added. "At this time, it doesn't appear...man was targeting any members of Congress," police further said.

383.title: Woman accidentally becomes owner of 84 US houses instead of 1 after typo
383.article_body: A woman accidentally became the legal owner of an entire neighbourhood of 84 homes in the US after a typo error caused these properties to be included with the house that she bought. While she paid $594,481 for the property, faulty documents revealed that her purchase included an extra 84 properties and two common spaces estimated at around $50 million.

384.title: We don't think on those lines: Pant on competition with Karthik for T20 WC spot
384.article_body: India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant, on being asked about the competition with Dinesh Karthik for a spot in India's playing XI in the upcoming T20 World Cup, said, "We don't think on those lines." He added, "[It] depends on the coach and the captain." Both Karthik and Pant have been named in the squad for the Asia Cup.

385.title: Our daughters are biggest hope for nation: President Murmu
385.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu said that in most other well-established democracies, women had to wage long-drawn struggles to get the right to vote but India can be credited to have helped the world discover the true potential of democracy. "Our daughters are the biggest hope for the nation," President Murmu said on Sunday. Gender inequalities have reduced in India, she stated.

386.title: Pune signal waiting time increased from 90-120 seconds to 150-180 seconds
386.article_body: The Pune Traffic Police Department has extended signal waiting times at main chowks of the city to decongest and monitor traffic jams, reports said. The waiting time which was 90 to 120 seconds has now increased to 150 to 180 seconds. "The number of vehicles has increased...and so we need to keep finding ways to manage traffic," police said.

387.title: After 75 years, we've heard the sound of Made-in-India weapon in I-Day gun salute: PM Modi
387.article_body: During his Independence Day speech, PM Narendra Modi said, "After 75 years, we've heard the sound of a Made-in-India weapon in the Independence Day gun salute. I salute the Armed Forces for this feat." For the first time, a home-grown howitzer gun, Advanced Towed Artillery Gun System (ATAGS), was used for the 21-gun salute during the ceremony at Red Fort.

388.title: Vicky's 'Uri..' name inspired by Hrithik's in Lakshya, had same surname: Dhar
388.article_body: Filmmaker Aditya Dhar said he loves the movie 'Lakshya' and that actor Vicky Kaushal's name in 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' was inspired by actor Hrithik Roshan's name in 'Lakshya'. "Vicky's name in [Uri: The Surgical Strike] is...Vihaan Singh Shergill...[it] was inspired from Hrithik Roshan's name in 'Lakshya', which was...Karan Shergill," he said, adding that it was his tribute to 'Lakshya'.

389.title: US Congressional delegation visits Taiwan amid tensions with China
389.article_body: A five-member US Congressional delegation arrived in Taiwan on Sunday for a two-day visit amid tensions with China. This comes after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan earlier this month. Taiwan's Foreign Affairs Ministry shared pictures of the lawmakers' arrival on Twitter and said, "We thank the like-minded US lawmakers for the timely visit and unwavering support."

390.title: Issue of pending cases needs to be tackled at various levels: Justice Lalit
390.article_body: The issue of pending cases needs to be tackled at various levels, Justice UU Lalit said. Hindustan Times quoted Justice Lalit as saying, "When a criminal appeal remains pending in SC, it gives rise to tertiary litigation...One pending matter will beget more cases at different levels. Therefore, need is to tackle the one pending before the SC at the earliest."

391.title: He planned smooth transition to sustain his legacy: Jhunjhunwala's stock trading firm
391.article_body: Rare Enterprises, the stock trading company owned by Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, issued a statement after the demise of the billionaire investor. "True to his nature...he had planned and...executed a smooth transition to sustain and enhance his legacy," the firm said. Calling him a "true nationalist", it added, "His unwavering belief in Indian entrepreneurs and enterprise will certainly outlive him."

392.title: Hyderabad to face 36-hour water supply shutdown from Aug 16
392.article_body: The Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board (HMWSSB) said that over 3.5 lakh residents under the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) limits will be affected by the disruption of water supply for 36 hours starting August 16. The water supply will be hit for completing electric work and flyover construction being undertaken as part of Strategic Road Development Project.

393.title: I have 1 request to all Indians, change the mentality towards our women: PM Modi
393.article_body: During his address at Red Fort on Independence Day, PM Narendra Modi said, "I have one request to every Indian. Can we change the mentality towards our women in everyday life?" Adding that respect for women is an important pillar for India's growth, he stated, "Pride of Nari Shakti will play a vital role in fulfilling the dreams of India."

394.title: 2 women, 5 men pose as Mumbai Police in Delhi, rob wellness company; held
394.article_body: Two women and five men were arrested for allegedly posing as Mumbai Police personnel in Delhi and robbing a wellness company on August 10. "All of them were wearing Mumbai Police identity cards around their necks...They collected the employees' mobile phones and forced Yadav [owner of company] at gunpoint to call his wife and ask for the money," police added.

395.title: India needs to be a developed nation in next 25 years: PM Modi on Independence Day
395.article_body: Addressing the nation on Independence Day on Monday, PM Narendra Modi said that India needs to be a developed nation in the next 25 years. "I urge the youth to dedicate the next 25 years of their lives for the development of the nation. We will work towards even the development of the entire humanity," he added.

396.title: Jhunjhunwala had vision to back English Vinglish when no one did: R Balki
396.article_body: Filmmaker R Balki remembered late billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala and called him a great partner. "I was looking for a co-producer for 'English Vinglish'. That's when he came on board...our film was able to roll," he stated. Balki added that Jhunjhunwala had the vision to back 'English Vinglish' when many in the industry didn't have the confidence to do so.

397.title: BEST asked to pay ₹36 lakh to Mumbai man who lost his leg in road mishap
397.article_body: A Motor Accident Claims Tribunal (MACT) has ordered the Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) to pay over ₹36 lakhs to a 31-year-old man who lost his right leg after a BEST bus hit his motorcycle in Malad in 2017. The man Aslahuddin Shaikh claimed that the bus was rashly driven and had hit his bike from the rear.

398.title: PM Modi lists 5 resolves for the countrymen for the next 25 years on Independence Day
398.article_body: PM Narendra Modi in his Independence Day speech listed five resolves for the countrymen for the next 25 years. They are: Developed India, removing every ounce of gulami (slavery) in us, pride for our glorious heritage, unity and fulfilling our duties. PM Modi said, "I urge the youth to dedicate the next 25 years for the development of the nation."

399.title: India is mother of democracy, our nation's strength is in diversity: PM Modi at Red Fort
399.article_body: Addressing the nation from Red Fort on Independence Day, PM Narendra Modi said, "India is the mother of democracy." "Our nation has proven that we have the inherent strength coming from our diversity and the common thread of patriotism that makes India unshakeable," he added. PM Modi hoisted the National Flag on Independence Day for the ninth straight time.

400.title: At least 300 employees at TikTok previously worked for Chinese state media: Report
400.article_body: As many as 300 current employees at TikTok and its parent company ByteDance previously worked for Chinese state media publications, as per a report. The report added that 15 of these employees currently work for both organisations. Meanwhile, a ByteDance spokesperson said that the company "does not allow employees to hold second or part-time jobs or any outside business activity".

401.title: PM Modi hoists National Flag at Red Fort on Independence Day for 9th straight time
401.article_body: PM Narendra Modi today hoisted National Flag for the ninth straight time at the Red Fort on the occasion of Independence Day. Only former Prime Ministers Jawaharlal Nehru (17), Indira Gandhi (16) and Manmohan Singh (10) have hoisted the National Flag at Red Fort on Independence Day more times than PM Modi. India is celebrating its 76th Independence Day today.
